-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.meta_keywords: how to introduce myself in interview,job interview,self-introduction
-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.content:
How to Introduce Myself in Interview: 12 Tips for a Successful Job Interview

Preparing for a job interview can be exciting but also a little overwhelming. There are many things you need to get ready for, like researching the company, practicing your answers, and choosing the right outfit. One important step is learning how to introduce myself in interview.

Every job interview begins with a self-introduction. This is your first chance to make a good impression on the interviewer. A strong introduction can set the tone for the rest of the interview, helping you feel more confident as you answer other questions.

If you are wondering how to introduce myself in interview, you come to the right place. In this article, we will share some tips for making an impactful self-introduction for a job interview and why it is important. We will also talk about things you should prepare for your job interview. We gathered these tips from various sources, Tuesday (24/12/2024).

Why Is It Important to Make an Impactful Introduction in a Job Interview?

Your self-introduction is the first thing the interviewer hears about you. It is their first impression of your personality, communication skills, and confidence. A good introduction helps you stand out from other candidates and sets a professional tone.

When you introduce yourself clearly and confidently, it shows that you are well-prepared and serious about the position. Interviewers appreciate candidates who can explain who they are and why they are a great fit for the role. On the other hand, a weak or unorganized introduction might make the interviewer doubt your abilities.

Remember, the goal of your self-introduction is to grab the interviewer’s attention and make them curious to learn more about you. This is why preparing a clear and professional introduction is so important.

How to Introduce Myself in Interview

Making a great self-introduction is key to starting the interview on the right foot. Below are detailed tips to help you introduce yourself effectively:

1. Greet the Interviewer

Always begin with a warm and polite greeting. Smile, make eye contact, and say something like, “Good morning, Mr. Smith.” This small gesture helps you appear respectful and approachable, creating a positive first impression.

2. State Your Name and Basic Information

Clearly mention your name and one or two basic details about yourself. For instance: “My name is John, and I recently graduated in Computer Science from ABC University.” This gives the interviewer a clear starting point from which to learn about you.

3. Mention Your Professional Background

Share relevant experience and skills. For example, “I have three years of experience in software development, specializing in creating user-friendly applications that improved customer engagement by 25%.” Focus on achievements that match the job requirements.

4. Talk About Your Interest in the Job

Express enthusiasm for the role and how it aligns with your goals. For instance: “I am excited about this position because it will allow me to apply my skills in project management while contributing to your team’s success.”

5. Keep It Brief

Avoid lengthy introductions by focusing only on key points. Aim for 1–2 minutes. A brief introduction shows that you respect the interviewer’s time and helps keep the conversation engaging.

6. Be Confident, Not Arrogant

Confidence helps you stand out, but arrogance can leave a negative impression. Instead of saying, “I’m the best candidate,” say, “I believe my skills and experience make me a great fit for this role.”

7. Avoid Negative Language

Never talk about failures or weaknesses in your introduction. Focus on your strengths and achievements. For example, avoid saying, “I lack experience in this field,” and highlight a transferable skill instead.

8. Speak Clearly and Slowly

When speaking, ensure your words are clear, and your pace is steady. Rushing through your introduction can make you appear nervous while speaking clearly shows confidence and professionalism.

9. Show Enthusiasm

Display genuine excitement for the opportunity. Smile and speak in a lively tone to show your passion for the role. Enthusiasm can help the interviewer see your dedication and eagerness to contribute.

10. Practice, but Don’t Memorize

Practice your self-introduction multiple times, but avoid memorizing it word for word. A rehearsed tone can sound robotic. Instead, aim for a natural delivery with key points in mind to stay flexible during the conversation.

11. Maintain Positive Body Language

Your body language speaks volumes about your confidence. Sit up straight, make eye contact, and avoid crossing your arms. These nonverbal cues show you are attentive, professional, and comfortable in the interview setting.

12. End with a Thank You

Conclude your introduction by thanking the interviewer. For instance: “Thank you for giving me the opportunity to introduce myself. I am excited to discuss how I can contribute to your team.” A polite ending leaves a good impression.

Things to Prepare Before a Job Interview

Preparation is key to performing well in a job interview. Below are detailed tips to help you get ready and feel confident before the big day:

1. Research the Company

Learn about the company’s mission, values, products, or services. Check their website and recent news to understand their culture and goals. This helps you tailor your answers and show genuine interest in joining their team.

2. Practice Your Self-Introduction

Rehearse your self-introduction in front of a mirror or with a friend. Practicing helps reduce nervousness and ensures that your delivery is clear and confident. It also allows you to refine your words for maximum impact.

3. Know the Job Description

Study the job posting carefully and identify key skills the company is looking for. Match your qualifications to these requirements so you can confidently explain why you are the best fit for the role.

4. Prepare Your Resume

Bring several copies of your updated resume. Highlight your most relevant skills and achievements that align with the job. A well-organized resume shows professionalism and helps the interviewer understand your experience better.

5. Choose the Right Outfit

Dress appropriately for the company’s work culture. For formal workplaces, choose professional attire, like a suit or blouse with trousers. Dressing neatly and appropriately gives a strong first impression of your seriousness and respect for the opportunity.

6. Prepare Answers to Common Questions

Think about your answers to questions like “Tell me about yourself,” “Why do you want this job?” and “What are your strengths and weaknesses?” Being prepared helps you avoid awkward pauses and ensures your responses are thoughtful.

7. Bring a Notebook and Pen

Carry a notebook to take notes during the interview if necessary. It shows that you are organized and professional. You can also use it to write down questions you want to ask the interviewer.

8. Stay Calm and Positive

Get plenty of rest the night before and eat a healthy meal. Take deep breaths to calm your nerves. A positive attitude will help you perform better and show the interviewer that you can handle stressful situations.

-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.meta_description: A producer named Danny Rossner is willing to pay Pitt and Jolie high if they return to acting in one frame.
-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.content:
Brad Pitt-Angelina Jolie Offered High Salary to Star in a Movie Together

Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie are said to be offered a large fee if they are willing to return to acting on the big screen in the same movie.

As Page Six reported on Tuesday (Dec 10), a producer named Danny Rossner is willing to pay Pitt and Jolie high if they return to acting in one frame.

Rossner was previously the producer of 2001: A Space Travesty with Leslie Nielsen and The Ultimate Weapon with Hulk Hogan.

Rossner said he was serious about the offer and had raised around US$60 million from his backers for Pitt and Jolie's fees.

However, Page Six said the offer would be difficult for the former couple, who have been in conflict for the past eight years over child custody, money, and the fate of their winery business.

Especially during the 2024 Venice Film Festival last September, the organizers had to arrange for Jolie and Pitt's films at the festival to be on different days to prevent the two from meeting.

"There was no way they could see each other at the Lido," Venice Film Festival 2024 artistic director Alberto Barbera told Vanity Fair.

Rossner, who is more known for working on B-grade films than high-end ones, described Jolie and Pitt's film imagery as his favorite project in more than twenty years.

The movie project is a love story set in Cannes' Hotel Martinez during World War II, based on the original story of the hotel's owner.

In Rossner's mind, Pitt will be projected to play Emmanuel Martinez, the hotel owner, while Jolie will play Emma Digard, Emmanuel's love interest.

"There's a love scene... It's also very hot. It's not obscene, but there's a very heavy love scene. [Martinez] has a wife and he has a mistress [Emma]," Rossner said.

Rossner said an agreement has not yet been reached regarding the division of fees for the former couple. But Page Six said this would be critical for Jolie if the offer came to her desk.

"Right now, in my opinion, Brad Pitt makes about US$20 to US$25 million [per movie] and Angelina Jolie about US$15 million," Rossner said. "We are prepared to offer about 50 percent above the existing price."

That means Brad Pitt would be offered a fee of around US$37.5 million, while Jolie's would be around US$22 million.

"If we can make a ceasefire between Israel and Lebanon, [Pitt and Jolie] can put aside their differences and come together to build bridges and make this movie," Rossner said confidently.

Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie first met in the movie project Mr. & Mrs. Smith in 2004 and later became the most famous couple to have the nickname "Brangelina".

They went on to become parents to six children, both biological and adopted, namely Maddox, who is now 23 years old, Pax, 21, Zahara, 19, Shiloh, 18, and twins Knox and Vivienne, 16.

Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie later divorced and began their separation drama 8 years ago. The feud involved allegations of domestic violence, child custody battles, businesses, and the removal of Pitt's name by his own children.

In this neo-noir crime thriller, Gosling plays a Hollywood stuntman who also works as a taxi driver. The film, directed by Nicolas Winding Refn, has been highly praised for its stylish visuals, intense atmosphere, and Gosling's charming performance.

This musical romantic comedy-drama showcases Gosling's versatility as he portrays a jazz pianist who falls in love with an aspiring actress, played by Emma Stone. Directed by Damien Chazelle, the film received critical acclaim and won six Academy Awards, including Best Director for Chazelle.

In this science fiction sequel to the cult classic "Blade Runner," Gosling portrays a new blade runner named Officer K. Directed by Denis Villeneuve, the film received critical acclaim for its stunning visuals, thought-provoking themes, and Gosling's nuanced performance.

Blade Runner 2049 (2017)

In this indie drama, Gosling delivers a remarkable performance as Dan Dunne, a history teacher with a drug addiction. The film explores his relationship with one of his students, played by Shareeka Epps. Gosling's portrayal earned him an Academy Award nomination for Best Actor.

Here Is Saudi Arabia Stadium for the Upcoming 2034 World Cup

A few days ago, Saudi Arabia officially announced plans for the King Salman International Stadium, a 92,000-seat venue designed to host the opening match and final of the 2034 FIFA World Cup.

Located north of Riyadh, the stadium is said to be the largest in the country and is scheduled for completion in 2029.

The design of this magnificent stadium is inspired by the natural environment of Saudi Arabia and is meant to symbolise growth and development.

Saudi Arabia reveals first look of 2034 World Cup stadium 🤯🔥

(📸: wearepopulous) pic.twitter.com/Rn6Ti3uDqz

— Complex Sports (@ComplexSports) November 23, 2024

"The design philosophy reflects a commitment to cutting-edge infrastructure while paying tribute to the intrinsic connection between sustainable development, human activity, and the natural world," said Shireen Hamdan,the general manager of Populous KSA.

According to a CNN report, the stadium will have a Royal Box, 2,500 VIP seats, a skybox for hospitality, and a rooftop garden that offers a beautiful view of King Abdulaziz Park.

The stadium will also have compact seating that will enhance the spectator experience while meeting international standards for field sports. In fact, the venue is also said to host non-sporting events such as concerts for example.

Saudi Arabia will be the single host for the upcoming 2034 World Cup

Although still awaiting official confirmation from FIFA, Saudi Arabia is the sole candidate to host the 2034 World Cup.

The final decision is expected to be made on 11 December at a meeting of 211 FIFA member federations.

If selected to host, Saudi Arabia plans to organise matches at 15 stadiums in five cities: Riyadh, Jeddah, Al Khobar, Abha and Neom.

75 Family Feud Questions for Kids and Adults: Let's Spice Up the Game Night

Have you ever played a fun game where you have to guess the most popular answers to simple questions? That is what Family Feud is all about! Family Feud is a popular game where two teams compete by answering survey questions. The goal is to guess the most common answers given by people in a survey. It is a fun and exciting game that brings family and friends together. Family Feud questions challenge players to think quickly and guess what most people would say.

Playing Family Feud is easy. One person, called the host, asks a question, and players try to guess the top answers. The team with the most correct guesses earns points. The team with the highest score wins the game. Family Feud questions can cover many topics, from food and travel to movies and everyday life. This makes the game fun for all ages.

5 Haunted Places in Montreal: Delving into the Mysteries of The Fantômes City

5 Haunted Places in Montreal: Delving into the Mysteries of The Fantômes City

Montreal, Canada, is a city known for its rich culture and history.

Montreal also hides some eerie secrets in its streets. It ranges from ghostly apparitions to unexplained phenomena. Montreal has several haunted places that will send shivers down your spine. In this article, we explore the mysteries of "The Fantômes City" and uncover five haunted locations bound to pique your curiosity.

Haunted Places in Montreal

1. Dorchester Square

Dorchester Square is a beautiful park in the heart of downtown Montreal. It is rumored to be haunted.

It is rumored to be haunted. Visitors have reported seeing shadowy figures walking among the trees and feeling an eerie presence at night—some claim to have heard whispers and disembodied voices in this historic square.

Whether you believe in ghosts or not, visiting Dorchester Square after dark might leave you questioning what you just saw.

Haunted Places in Montreal

2. Malefycia Haunted House

For those seeking a frightening experience, look no further than Malefycia Haunted House. It is located in the heart of Montreal.

This haunted spot is not for the faint of heart. With its decorated sets, terrifying actors, and immersive storytelling, Malefycia Haunted House promises to give you a fright like no other.

It is said that the building itself has a dark history, adding to the spooky atmosphere. Whether you believe in the supernatural or not, Malefycia Haunted House will test your bravery.

Haunted Places in Montreal

3. Château Ramezay

Step back in time and enter the world of ghostly tales at Château Rame zay. This historic building dates back to the 18th century.

It is said to be haunted by the ghosts of its former residents.

It is said to be haunted by the ghosts of its former residents. Visitors have reported hearing footsteps echoing through the halls and feeling a cold presence in certain rooms. One famous ghost sighting is a woman in a white dress wandering the grounds. Take a guided tour of Château Ramezay and listen to the stories of the past, but be prepared for a possible encounter with the supernatural.

Haunted Places in Montreal

Montreal's old Red-Light District is also known as "The Main." It was once a hub of vice and sin. It is said that the spirits of those who lived and died in this area still linger today.

4. Montreal's Old Red-Light District

Visitors have reported seeing shadowy figures and disembodied voices in the alleyways and abandoned buildings—some claim to have felt a chill in the air, as if unseen eyes were watching them.

While the district has transformed over the years, its haunted past remains. The building reminds visitors of the city's dark history.

Haunted Places in Montreal

5. The Grey Nuns in Montreal

The Grey Nuns Hospital is now part of Concordia University. It is rumored to be haunted by the spirits of the nuns who once resided there.

The building has a long and tragic history, with reports of ghostly apparitions, strange noises, and unexplained phenomena. Visitors have claimed to see shadowy figures walking through the halls and have felt a ghostly presence in certain rooms. Whether you believe in ghosts or not, visiting The Grey Nuns will surely give you an unforgettable and possibly terrifying experience.

In conclusion, Montreal is not just a city of culture and history but also a city with haunted places.

It ranges from ghostly apparitions in Dorchester Square to the chilling experiences at Malefycia house. These places offer a glimpse into the supernatural side of "The Fantômes City."

Quotes About Goals: 30 Powerful Words to Guide Your Path to Success

Quotes About Goals: 30 Powerful Words to Guide Your Path to Success 

Goals give us direction, purpose, and motivation to strive for something greater. However, it's not easy to reach our goals. Usually, the road to success is full of obstacles that can make us feel down or even want to give up. This is why you need quotes about goals to give you extra motivation to keep going forward and reach your goals.

The wisdom and encouragement found in quotes about goals serve as powerful ways to support us in achieving our goals. They also serve as reminders of the importance of perseverance and determination in our journey to success. 

In this article, we will explore a collection of quotes about goals. Each quote carries a unique message to guide and empower you on your journey to achieving your dreams.

Best Quotes About Goals

  • "Goals are not only absolutely necessary to motivate us. They are essential to really keep us alive." – Robert H. Schuller

  • "Never give up. Today is hard, tomorrow will be worse, but the day after tomorrow will be sunshine." - Jack Ma

  • "There's nothing better than achieving your goals, whatever they might be." – Paloma Faith

  • "It must be borne in mind that the tragedy of life doesn't lie in not reaching your goal. The tragedy lies in having no goals to reach." —Benjamin E. Mays


  • "When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps." – Confucius

  •  "In between goals is a thing called life, that has to be lived and enjoyed."– Sid Caeser

  • "I think goals should never be easy, they should force you to work, even if they are uncomfortable at the time." —Michael Phelps

  • "The trouble with not having a goal is that you can spend your life running up and down the field and never score." —Bill Copeland

  • "If a goal is worth having, it's worth blocking out the time in your day-to-day life necessary to achieve it."– Jill Koenig

  • "The greater danger for most of us isn't that our aim is too high and miss it, but that it is too low and we reach it."– Michelangelo

Inspirational Quotes About Goals 

  • "It's an up and down thing, the human goals, because the human is always an explorer, an adventurist." – Cesar Millan

  • "You cannot expect to achieve new goals or move beyond your present circumstances unless you change." – Les Brown

  • "It's better to be at the bottom of the ladder you want to climb than at the top of the one you don't." –Stephen Kellogg

  • "You should set goals beyond your reach so you always have something to live for." —Ted Turner


  • "A good goal is like a strenuous exercise — it makes you stretch."– Mary Kay Ash

  • "Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible."– Tony Robbins
  • "Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do."– Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

  • "One way to keep momentum going is to have constantly greater goals."– Michael Korda

  • "People often say I have so much energy, that I never stop; but that's what it takes to accomplish your goals." – Curtis Jackson

  • "Where are the people who don't have goals headed? Those 97 percent end up working for the three percent." – Shiv Khera

Motivational Quotes About Goals 

  • "Set realistic goals, keep re-evaluating, and be consistent." – Ginni Rometti

  • "Stay focused, go after your dreams and keep moving toward your goals." – LL Cool J

  • "If you want to be happy, set a goal that commands your thoughts, liberates your energy and inspires your hopes." —Andrew Carnegie

  •  "All successful people have a goal. No one can get anywhere unless he knows where he wants to go and what he wants to be or do." – Norman Vincent Peale

  • "If you want to live a happy life, tie it to a goal, not to people or things."– Albert Einstein

  • "There are only two rules for being successful. One, figure out exactly what you want to do, and two, do it."– Mario Cuomo

  • "If you set your goals ridiculously high and it's a failure, you will fail above everyone else's success." – James Cameron

  • "I am constantly re-evaluating my goals and trying to strike items from my to-do list that aren't critical." – Aisha Tyler

  • "We think, mistakenly, that success is the result of the amount of time we put in at work, instead of the quality of time we put in." — Arianna Huffington

  • "You can't be that kid standing at the top of the waterslide, overthinking it. You have to go down the chute." - Tina Fey

Author

Rizki Amelia Putri (Intern Writer)

7 Surprising Facts About Marvel Comics That Are Unexpected

7 Surprising Facts About Marvel Comics That Are Unexpected

Marvel Comics is the classic powerhouse of superhero lore. Marvel Comics has woven a tapestry of stories that have become crucial to pop culture. However, behind the colorful panels and iconic characters lies a series of surprising twists.

These facts about Marvel Comics are what the most eager fans might find surprising. It ranges from Michael Jackson's Spider-Man dreams to a failed try at trademarking "zombies." The Marvel universe is full of tales that defy expectations and add a layer of intrigue to its already rich history.

Let's check out some surprising facts about Marvel Comics, compiled from numerous sources, on Sunday (26/11/2023).

In a unique turn of events, the King of Pop, Michael Jackson, desired to don the web-slinger's suit.

1. Michael Jackson's Spider-Man Aspirations

In the early 1990s, he wanted to buy Marvel Comics to play Spider-Man in his cinematic creations. Stan Lee, the legendary creator of many Marvel superheroes, shared in an interview about it. Jackson's fascination was mainly centered on the iconic wall-crawling superhero, Spider-Man.

2. Marvel's Unsuccessful Attempt to Trademark "Zombies"

In a weird chapter in Marvel's legal efforts, the comic giant tried to trademark the word "zombies" in 1973. However, this effort confirmed hopelessness. It is given the widespread use of the term in various contexts. Marvel finally did manage to trademark "superhero." It showcases the lengths the company went to protect its intellectual property.

3. Spider-Man's Rocky Start

Before swinging into the hearts of millions, Spider-Man faced rejection from Marvel's editor, Martin Goodman.

Initially passed over due to "arachnophobia," spiders are not most people’s favorite insects. Spider-Man finally became one of the most beloved superheroes of all time, thanks to the vision and creativity of Stan Lee.

Facts About Marvel Comics

4. Artist's Resignation Letter in Iron Man Comic

In a quirky episode in comic book history, Marvel artist Dave Cockrum's resignation letter found its way into Iron Man No. 127. The letter mirrors Cockrum's original resignation. It was incorporated into the storyline as Tony Stark's butler, Jarvis, resigned. Whether a mistake or a planned inclusion, it remains a weird anecdote in the Marvel story.

The Hulk is known for his iconic green hue. He was initially created to be gray. Printing issues, however, led to a color change, and the rich green Hulk we realize today was born.

5. The Hulk's Gray Origins

Venom is one of Spider-Man's most formidable rivals in Marvel Comics. This character wasn't born in the Marvel offices but in the creative mind of a fan named Randy Schueller.

6. Venom: A Fan's Creation

He won a Marvel Comics contest in 1982. Schueller's concept art laid the foundation for the iconic character. Marvel purchased the idea for $220.00.

7. Amalgam Comics

In a rare collaboration, DC and Marvel joined powers to create "Amalgam Comics." This unique track saw the merging of characters from both universes. It gave rise to fascinating hybrids like Dark Claw (Batman and Wolverine), Super Soldier (Superman and Captain America), and Dare The Terminator (Deathstroke and Daredevil), among others.

Marvel Comics is a universe known for its larger-than-life characters and narratives.

Marvel Comics continues to surprise and delight audiences with its incredible tales. It ranges from celebrity dreams of dreaming of the superhero mantle to legal battles over common words. These facts about Marvel Comics add a layer of intrigue to Marvel's already exciting legacy. As we continue to explore the Marvel universe, these surprising facts remind us that even the most fantastic realm is not without its share of extraordinary realities.

Facts About Marvel Comics

The 7 Best Free Things to Do in Singapore

Singapore is one of the most popular destinations in Southeast Asia. Millions of travelers visit this modern city every year for its amazing attractions and culture. Many people think Singapore is expensive, but you can explore this beautiful country without spending much money.

Singapore has many exciting and fun things to do that cost nothing at all. It is full of green parks, beautiful beaches, and interesting cultural areas waiting to be explored. You can discover vibrant neighborhoods, peaceful gardens, and world-famous landmarks completely free.

If you are looking to visit Singapore on a budget, here are seven fun and free things to do in Singapore you can add to your list:

1. Enjoy the Breathtaking Beauty of Gardens by the Bay

Gardens by the Bay is one of Singapore's most famous attractions. While the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest require tickets, entry to the outdoor gardens is completely free. You can visit the Supertree Grove and see amazing plants from around the world. At night, these giant trees light up with colorful displays that create a magical atmosphere for all visitors.

2. Snap a Picture of the Merlion

The Merlion is Singapore's most famous symbol and national icon. This unique statue has a lion's head and a fish's body, representing the city's rich history and culture. Located at Merlion Park, it offers great views of Marina Bay and the city skyline. Many tourists come here to take photos with this landmark and enjoy the beautiful waterfront area.

3. Visit the Beach of Sentosa Island

Sentosa Island is a popular resort island located just off Singapore's coast. You can enter for free by walking or cycling via the Sentosa Boardwalk or taking Bus 123. Once there, enjoy several public beaches including Siloso Beach, Palawan Beach, and Tanjong Beach at no cost. There are also some trails to explore the natural beauty of the island.

4. Explore the Beautiful Nature of MacRitchie Reservoir

MacRitchie Reservoir is a peaceful place to enjoy Singapore's natural beauty. You can walk on trails around the water and see many types of plants and animals in their natural habitat. The reservoir has several hiking paths for different fitness levels. Many people come here to exercise, take nature photos, or simply enjoy the quiet environment away from city life.

5. Relaxing at the Singapore Botanic Gardens

The Singapore Botanic Gardens is a UNESCO World Heritage site featuring beautiful plants and trees from around the world. You can walk through different garden sections and see tropical flowers, rare plants, and peaceful lakes. The gardens are perfect for picnics, morning walks, or afternoon relaxation. Many families visit here to enjoy nature and learn about various plant species.

6. Climb to the Fort Canning

Fort Canning is a historic hill located in the center of Singapore's city area. You can climb to the top and enjoy panoramic views of the modern city skyline below. The hill features walking paths, ancient ruins, and interesting historical sites that tell Singapore's story. Many people come here for exercise and to learn about the country's fascinating past and heritage.

7. Explore the Chinatown

 Chinatown is a colorful and vibrant neighborhood full of rich culture and fascinating history. You can walk through the busy streets and see beautiful old buildings, traditional temples, and unique shops selling local goods. Visit the famous Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Sri Mariamman Temple for free. The area has many food stalls where you can try authentic local dishes at reasonable prices.

5 Health Benefits of Snake Venom You Should Know

5 Health Benefits of Snake Venom You Should Know

Snake venom is known to be the most deadly substance in the world.

This is because snake venom can kill any creature, including humans in just a matter of time.

However, according to many studies, snake venom can be used as a medical treatment.

In this list, we will show you 5 medical benefits of snake venom that you should know about!

Some snake venoms contain anticoagulant compounds that can prevent blood clotting. These compounds have been studied for their potential use in medications for conditions such as deep vein thrombosis (DVT) and other blood clotting disorders.

Anticoagulant Properties

Certain components in snake venom, such as peptides, have analgesic properties. They can block pain signals and have been researched for potential use in developing new pain relief medications.

Pain Relief

Components found in snake venom have been studied for their ability to lower blood pressure. Some snake venom peptides have vasodilatory effects, meaning they can widen blood vessels, which may have applications in the development of cardiovascular medications.

Cardiovascular Medications

Snake venom toxins have been used in neuroscience research to better understand the functioning of the nervous system. They have been valuable tools for studying neurotransmitters, receptors, and ion channels.

Neurological Research

Some compounds in snake venom have shown potential in cancer research. Certain venom proteins can disrupt the growth of cancer cells and have been investigated as possible anticancer agents.

Cancer Research

-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.meta_description: Animal protein from fish is beneficial for the body's health. However, some fish are not recommended for those with high blood pressure.
-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.meta_keywords: Fish that are not good for high blood pressure
-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.content:
5 Fish Not Recommended for High Blood Pressure Patients

For people with hypertension, several types of fish should be avoided. Let's take a look at them!

5 Fish Not Recommended for High Blood Pressure Patients

People with a history of hypertension are strongly advised to maintain their diet.

Reducing the intake of high-salt and high-fat foods, especially red meat, is important.

As an alternative, many people choose to get their protein from fish.

However, not all types of fish are suitable for those with high blood pressure.

To be more cautious, here is a list of fish that should be avoided or consumed in moderation by hypertensive individuals.

1. Farmed Salmon Fish

Reducing farmed salmon consumption is highly recommended because it is usually raised in congested waters. The farm location has a high risk of being exposed to parasites and other diseases.

If you want to enjoy this fish, it is better to choose salmon raised according to good cultivation standards.

2. Sole Fish

Flatfish, a type of fish with upward-facing eyes, contains a significant amount of sodium. Therefore, it is advisable for those with hypertension not to consume it.

3. Sharks

Usually, shark dishes are considered as expensive and prestigious cuisines.

However, it is surprising that this fish should be avoided, especially by those who suffer from high blood pressure.

In fact, sharks contain high levels of mercury in their bodies, which can have negative effects on health.

4. Roughy Fish

The Red Roughy fish, also known as the Rough Red, is included in the list of fish that should be avoided for consumption due to its relatively long lifespan.

Why is this a concern?

Considering its long lifespan, there is a worry that this fish has been exposed to various harmful substances that can pose a threat to human health when consumed.

5. Bluefin Tuna

The concentration of mercury in Bluefin Tuna is also found to be high. According to a study published in the journal Hypertension, mercury can increase blood pressure.

Not only from a health perspective, but also in terms of population numbers, Bluefin Tuna is decreasing due to continuous hunting.

Not consuming these fish is not only beneficial for our health but also for maintaining their population in open sea waters.

5 America's Haunted Prisons and Jails Part I

America is home to some of the most infamous prisons and jails, many of which have a dark and haunting past.

It ranges from tales of ghostly apparitions to unexplained phenomena. These institutions are said to be haunted by the spirits of former inmates and guards.

If you're a fan of the paranormal or looking for a spooky adventure, here's a guide to 5 haunted prisons and jails in America that you might want to visit. Let's check it out:










America's Haunted Prisons and Jails

This prison operated for over 168 years before closing its doors in 2004. It was known for its harsh conditions and violent history, with reports of riots and executions. Visitors have reported seeing shadowy figures. Some guests also heard disembodied voices throughout the abandoned halls.

1. Missouri State Penitentiary, Jefferson City

Ghost tours (14+ only) are $30 per person, 3 hours (14+ only) are $40 per person, ghost hunting classes (14+ only) are $40 per person, and overnight paranormal investigations (18+ only) are $75 and $100 per person.

flickr/Donnie King

2. Brushy Mountain State Penitentiary

Brushy Mountain State Penitentiary is located in Tennessee. This penitentiary was known as one of the toughest prisons in America. It housed some of the most notorious criminals, including James Earl Ray, the assassin of Martin Luther King Jr.

Visitors have reported strange noises and cold spots while exploring the prison.

A Brushy Mountain State Penitentiary tour costs $480 (6 people max), and an overnight investigation costs $1500 (12 people max).

Perhaps one of the most famous prisons in America, Alcatraz is known for its history of housing some of the country's most dangerous criminals. The island prison is known for being haunted by former inmates.

3. Alcatraz, San Francisco

Visitors claim to see ghostly apparitions and eerie sounds echoing through the empty cells.

Prices start from as little as $25 and include a ferry and audio tour as standard. Tickets are available from City Experiences. Check this: Alcatraz Tour

This historic prison was once home to notorious criminals such as Al Capone. It is said to be haunted by the spirits of former inmates who suffered in solitary confinement.

4. Eastern State Penitentiary, Philadelphia, PA

Visitors have reported hearing whispers and feeling a sense of unease while touring the decrepit cell blocks. Year-round daytime tours are available from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. for $13 for children (ages 7-12), $13 for students, $15 for seniors, and $17 for adults. Check this out: Eastern State Penitentiary

flickr/Kelly Verdeck

5. Ohio State Reformatory, Mansfield:

Ohio State Reformatory is famous for its appearance in the film "The Shawshank Redemption." This prison is said to be haunted by former inmates who died within its walls. Visitors have reported seeing shadowy figures and feeling a sense of dread in the eerie corridors.

Public ghost hunts (18+ only) are offered on select Fridays and Saturdays throughout the year. Tickets are $99 per person and include access to the prison from 7 p.m. until 3 a.m., including a pizza and soda dinner. The prison also offers 2-hour guided ghost walks, from 8–10 p.m. or 10:30 p.m.–12:30 a.m., priced at $45 per person (13+ only).

Are you a believer in the paranormal or just looking for a spooky adventure?

These haunted prisons and jails in America will bring you to the dark history of the criminal justice system. From tales of ghostly apparitions to unexplained phenomena, these places will send shivers down your spine.

If you're brave enough to take a ghost tour, be prepared for an unforgettable experience in these haunted jails. Who knows, you may encounter a spirit from the past within the walls of these infamous prisons and jails.

7 Best Areas To Visit In Denver: The Ultimate Guide To Fast Relief

7 Best Areas To Visit In Denver: The Ultimate Guide To Fast Relief

Denver, Colorado, is a vibrant city with various attractions for visitors. It ranges from art museums to outdoor parks.

There is something for everyone to explore in Denver. In this article, we will highlight the six best areas to visit in Denver for fast relief and relaxation.

Best Areas To Visit In Denver

flickr/City and County Denver

1. Denver Art Museum

The Denver Art Museum is home to a vast collection of art worldwide. It includes pieces by renowned artists such as Van Gogh and Monet. Visitors can spend hours wandering through the galleries, taking in the beauty and creativity of each piece.

The Denver Botanic Gardens is a must-visit destination for those who love nature. With over 24 acres of open gardens, visitors can enjoy a peaceful stroll among beautiful flowers and plants.

2. Denver Botanic Gardens

3. Red Rocks Park & Amphitheatre

Known for its breathtaking natural beauty and iconic concert venue, Red Rocks Park & Amphitheatre. They offer visitors a unique experience. 

Whether attending a live show or exploring the park's hiking trails, this area will give you a sense of calm and relaxation.

flickr/Grace Liu

4. Rocky Mountain National Park

Just a short drive from Denver, Rocky Mountain National Park is an outdoor lover's paradise. With over 415 square miles of wilderness to explore, visitors can enjoy hiking, camping, and wildlife watching in this natural setting.

Union Station is a bustling hub of activity. It is a historical landmark in the heart of downtown Denver. Visitors can enjoy shopping, dining, and people-watching in this beautifully restored train station.

5. Denver Union Station

6. Sloan Lake

Sloan Lake is a peaceful oasis located just west of downtown Denver. Visitors can enjoy a relaxing walk or bike ride around the lake. You can take in the beautiful views of the city skyline and even experience water activities such as paddleboarding or kayaking.

7. Platte River Trail

Situated in the heart of Denver, the Platte River Trail is one of the best areas to visit. This scenic trail along the river has a peaceful escape.

This destination has well-maintained paths and breathtaking views. These features make it an ideal spot for jogging, biking, or relaxing walks. Surrounded by lush greenery and the soothing sound of flowing water, the trail provides a calm retreat within the urban landscape. The Platte River Trail shows Denver's natural beauty.

Whether you want to engage in art and culture, explore the great outdoors, or relax and unwind, Denver has something for everyone.

So next time you're in the Mile High City, check out these best areas to visit in Denver for a truly unforgettable experience.

6 Haunted Places in Flagstaff, Arizona, with a Ghostly Past to Explore

Flagstaff, Arizona, is a quaint town in the US. Flagstaff is known for its stunning views of the San Francisco Peaks and charming downtown area.

But did you know that Flagstaff also has a spooky side?

There are several haunted places in Flagstaff with ghostly pasts. These mystical spots will send shivers down your spine. They range from historic homes to old libraries. Here are five haunted places in Flagstaff, Arizona, sure to frighten you.





Haunted Places in Flagstaff, Arizona

1. McMillan House (McMillan Mesa)

McMillan House is rumored to be haunted by the ghost of a former resident. The house was built by Thomas McMillian in 1888. It has a long history of paranormal activity.
- illustration by Holidappy on pinterest

Visitors have reported having captured orbs on their phone cameras. Some also heard strange noises and saw shadowy figures throughout the house.

Some believe that the ghost is that of Mary McMillan, who tragically passed away in the home many years ago. Her spirit is said to still be in the house, making it one of the most haunted places in Flagstaff.

Haunted Places in Flagstaff, Arizona

2. Coconino County Public Library:

The Coconino County Public Library is another haunted spot in Flagstaff.

Built in 1908, the library has had numerous reports of ghostly activity. Visitors have claimed to see books flying off the shelves, hear whispers in empty rooms, and feel a cold presence.

Some believe the spirits of former librarians who loved the library so much they never wanted to leave it for the haunting.

Haunted Places in Flagstaff, Arizona

Riordan Mansion State Historic Park is a beautiful mansion built in 1904 by brothers Timothy and Michael Riordan.

3. Riordan Mansion State Historic Park:

The mansion is now a museum and is said to be haunted by Timothy Riordan's ghost. Visitors have reported hearing footsteps in empty rooms and shadows moving through empty hallways. Some believe that Timothy's spirit still roams the halls, unable to leave his beloved home behind.

4. Milligan House:

The Milligan House is located in downtown Flagstaff. This site is another haunted location with a chilling past.

Built in the early 1900s, this historic home is said to be haunted by the ghost of a former resident who met a tragic end.

Visitors have reported hearing unexplained noises, feeling sudden drops in temperature, and seeing objects move on their own. Some believe that the spirit of Mr. Milligan himself still resides in the house.

5. Hotel Monte Vista:

Hotel Monte Vista is one of Flagstaff's most famous haunted places. Built-in 1927, this historic hotel has seen its fair share of paranormal activity.

Guests and staff alike have reported seeing apparitions. Some also heard disembodied voices and felt unseen hands touching them.

One of the most famous ghost stories at Hotel Monte Vista is the spirit of a woman named Leone Jensen. She fell to her death from a window on the third floor.

Guests have reported seeing her ghost wandering the halls, dressed in 1930s attire. Another well-known spirit is that of a bellboy. He tragically died in the hotel and is said to roam the halls still, helping guests with their bags.

Haunted Places in Flagstaff, Arizona

flickr/Trevor Huxham

6. The Museum of Northern Arizona

The Museum of Northern Arizona was founded in 1928. It is also said to be haunted by the spirits of Native American ancestors. The museum houses a vast collection of artifacts and exhibits related to the region's history.

Visitors have reported hearing drums beating in the distance and seeing shadowy figures moving through the exhibits. Some also feel a sense of unease in some regions of the museum. Some believe that the spirits of their Native American ancestors protect their heritage and watch over the museum.

Flagstaff, Arizona, is home to several haunted places with ghostly pasts.

Do you believe in ghosts or not? These locations have a reputation for paranormal activity that intrigues visitors and locals alike. Each haunted place, from historic homes to iconic hotels, has a unique story.

-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.meta_description: These variants of the chayote recipe will transform this humble vegetable into a symphony of flavors.
-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.content:
4 Chayote Recipes that Showcase the Beauty of Culinary Innovation

4 Chayote Recipes that Showcase the Beauty of Culinary Innovation

Chayote is a versatile and nutritious vegetable.

Chayote has graced our plates with its overnice, crisp flavor for centuries. Chayote's versatility makes it an excellent addition to your culinary mastery. Whether you're a culinary adventurer or a home chef seeking new flavors, these four delightful chayote recipes will elevate your gastronomic experience.

istockphoto-

Tips On How To Cook Chayote

Chayote is a versatile and mild-flavored vegetable. Chayote recipes can be prepared in various ways. Feel free to get creative and discover new ways to enjoy this nutritious and delicious vegetable. Here are some tips on how to cook chayote:

  • Selection and Preparation: Choose chayotes that are firm, unblemished, and wrinkles-free. The skin should be smooth and pale green. Wash and peel the chayote before use. The skin is edible, but peeling helps remove any residual bitterness.

  • Cutting Techniques: Slice the chayote thinly or chop it into bite-sized pieces for stir-frying or sautéing. Cut cube or dice chayote for soups, stews, and salads.

  • Cooking Methods

Boiling: Boil chayote chunks until tender and use them in salads and soups, or mash them as a side dish.

Steaming: Steam chayote slices for a healthier option, preserving more nutrients.

Sautéing: Sauté chayote with garlic, onions, and your favorite herbs for a quick and flavorful side dish.

Roasting: Roast chayote cubes or slices in olive oil and spices for a delicious and caramelized flavor.

Flavor Combinations: Chayote has a mild taste, making it a versatile ingredient that pairs well with various flavors.

Experiment with herbs like thyme, rosemary, or cilantro. Enrich the flavor with garlic, onions, or ginger in savory dishes.

  • Combine in Various Dishes

Salads: Add raw or blanched chayote to salads for a refreshing crunch.

Stir-Fries: Sauté chayote with other vegetables and protein for a quick and nutritious stir-fry.

Soups and Stews: Use chayote in soups and stews to absorb the flavors of the broth.

Grilled or BBQ: Grill chayote slices for a smoky flavor, or include them on vegetable skewers.

  • Storing Chayote: Store chayote in a cool, dark place or the refrigerator for a longer shelf life. Once cut, wrap the unused portion in plastic wrap and refrigerate. Use within a few days.

  • Experimentation: Feel free to experiment with chayote in various cuisines. It can be a great addition to both Asian and Western dishes.

Chayote Recipes

istockphoto-

Creamy Chayote Soup

Ingredients:

  • 3 chayotes, peeled and diced
  • 1 onion, finely chopped
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 potatoes, peeled and diced
  • 4 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 cup milk or coconut milk
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh cilantro for garnish

Instructions:

1. In a pot, sauté onions and garlic until fragrant.

2. Add the chayotes and potatoes, stirring for a few minutes.

3. Pour in the vegetable broth and simmer until the vegetables are tender.

4. Blend the mixture until smooth.

5. Return to the pot, add milk, salt, and pepper, and simmer for an additional 10 minutes.

6. Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.

Sautéed Chayote Squash

Ingredients:

  • 4 chayotes, thinly sliced
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 3 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 teaspoon paprika
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh parsley for garnish

Instructions:

1. Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté garlic until golden.

2. Add chayote slices, paprika, salt, and pepper.

3. Sauté until the chayote is tender and slightly browned.

4. Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

Chinese Stir-Fried Chayote Recipe

Ingredients:

  • 2 chayotes, julienned
  • 1 tablespoon soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon oyster sauce
  • 1 tablespoon sesame oil
  • 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
  • 1 teaspoon ginger, grated
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 teaspoon sugar
  • Green onions for garnish

Instructions:

1. Heat vegetable oil in a wok or skillet.

2. Stir-fry ginger and garlic until aromatic.

3. Add chayote and stir-fry until slightly tender.

4. Mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, and sugar in a small bowl. Pour over the chayote and toss to coat.

5. Garnish with chopped green onions before serving.

Roasted Chayote Squash

Ingredients:

  • 3 chayotes, peeled and cubed
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • 1 teaspoon paprika
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh thyme for garnish

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).

2. Toss chayote cubes with olive oil, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.

3. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes or until golden.

4. Garnish with fresh thyme before serving.

Embrace your culinary journey with these delightful chayote recipes.

These variants will transform this humble vegetable into a symphony of flavors. Chayote recipes will leave your taste buds craving more. Experiment, enjoy, and savor the richness of chayote in every bite!

Chayote Recipes

Friday Motivational Quotes: 30 Uplifting Phrases to Wrap Up Your Busy Week

Friday Motivational Quotes: 30 Uplifting Phrases to Wrap Up Your Busy Week

Friday is an exciting day because it marks the end of the school or work week. On Friday, people typically lose focus as they get ready for the weekend. Therefore, they have to read Friday motivational quotes to stay enthusiastic and motivated to face the last day of the busy week.

Friday motivational quotes aim to encourage people to overcome challenges and reflect on their accomplishments. Also, finish the busy week with strong motivation and approach the weekend with optimism. Whether it's people in the workforce or students in schools, they deserve to receive and read these quotes.

This article contains 30 Friday motivational quotes to wrap up your busy week and start the weekend with excitement. Let's dive in and begin!

Friday Motivational Quotes to Uplift You

  • "Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going." — Sam Levenson

  • "When you leave work on Friday, leave work. Don't let technology follow you throughout your weekend (answering text messages and emails). Take a break; you will be more refreshed to begin the workweek if you have had a break." – Catherine Pulsifer

  • "Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do." - Steve Jobs

  • "Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful." - Albert Schweitzer
  • "Take a moment to appreciate how far you've come this week, and let the joy of Friday fuel your enthusiasm for the days ahead." - Unknown

  • "The only way to do great work is to love what you do." - Steve Jobs

  • "Believe you can and you're halfway there." - Theodore Roosevelt

  • "Friday is a reminder that even the toughest weeks can't dim the light within you." - Unknown

  • "Make a Friday a day to celebrate work well done that you can be proud of, knowing that you just didn't put in the time for the next paycheck." – Byron Pulsifer

  • "Celebrate the small victories, embrace the joy of Friday, and let positivity guide your path." - Unknown

Friday Motivational Quotes to End the Workweek

  • "Every Friday is a chance to reset, recharge, and rejoice. Let the weekend bring you joy and inspiration." - Unknown

7 Cooler Places to Visit in Summer in the US

7 Cooler Places to Visit in Summer in the US

As the summer heat rolls in, many people look for cooler places to escape to in the United States.

Whether you're seeking relief from scorching temperatures or simply prefer a more moderate climate, these destinations offer a refreshing getaway. From the wilderness of Alaska to the stunning national parks of Montana and Wyoming, here are seven cooler places to visit in summer in the US that are worth considering.

1. Fairbanks, Alaska

Known for its stunning landscapes, Fairbanks in Alaska offers a cool summer escape. With average temperatures in the mid-60s Fahrenheit, you can enjoy outdoor activities like hiking, fishing, and wildlife spotting without breaking a sweat.

Don't forget to visit the iconic Denali National Park and catch a glimpse of the tallest peak in North America. This beautiful national park located only around 2 hours from the city.

2. Acadia National Park, Maine

If you're looking for a coastal getaway, Acadia National Park is the place to go. With its rugged coastline, rocky beaches, and lush forests, this park offers a refreshing summer retreat.

The average temperature in July hovers around 70 degrees Fahrenheit, making it an ideal destination for hiking, biking, and exploring the picturesque coastal villages.

3. Glacier National Park, Montana

Experience the beauty of icy glaciers in the heart of summer at Glacier National Park.

With temperatures in the 70s Fahrenheit during the day, you can enjoy outdoor activities like hiking, camping, and kayaking while taking in the breathtaking views of rugged mountains and turquoise lakes.

4. Oregon Coast, Oregon

Escape the heat and immerse yourself in the cool coastal breeze along the Oregon Coast.

With average temperatures in the 60s Fahrenheit, you can explore charming beach towns, admire stunning sea stacks, and indulge in fresh seafood.

Make sure to visit Cannon Beach and marvel at the iconic Haystack Rock.

5. Portland, Maine

For a city escape with a cool summer climate, consider visiting Portland, Maine. With average temperatures in the mid-70s Fahrenheit, this charming city offers a vibrant food and arts scene.

Explore the historic Old Port district, stroll along the waterfront, and indulge in delicious lobster rolls.

6. Yellowstone National Park, Wyoming

Escape the summer heat by venturing into the beautiful wilderness of Yellowstone National Park.

With temperatures in the 70s Fahrenheit during the day, you can witness jaw-dropping geysers, vibrant hot springs, and diverse wildlife.

Don't forget to visit the iconic Old Faithful and take a dip in the cool waters of Yellowstone Lake.

7. Aspen, Colorado

If you're a fan of outdoor activities, head to Aspen, Colorado, for a refreshing summer vacation.

With average temperatures in the 70s Fahrenheit, you can enjoy hiking, mountain biking, and even skiing on the remaining patches of snow.

Explore the charming town, relax by the scenic Maroon Bells, and immerse yourself in the vibrant arts and culture scene.

Russo Brothers Set to Make Comeback to Direct 2 Avengers Films

Russo Brothers Set to Make Comeback to Direct 2 Avengers Films

Joe and Anthony Russo are rumored to return to the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) film project. The brothers, nicknamed the Russo Brothers, are projected to become directors for two Avengers films.

Based on The Hollywood Reporter report on Wednesday (July 17), a source said the Russo Brothers were in the early stages of discussions to be involved again as directors of two Avengers films.

However, no comment from Joe and Anthony Russo or Marvel Studios about the brothers' involvement.

If Joe and Anthony Russo agree to direct two Avengers films, this will be a comeback event for the brothers.

The Russo Brothers are no strangers to the Marvel universe. Both have been involved in several MCU films.

The two first got involved in the MCU when they directed Captain America: The Winter Soldier in 2014. After that, they also directed the second Captain America movie, Civil War, in 2016.

The Russo Brothers are also the directors behind the last two Avengers films that were a huge success in the market, namely Infinity War in 2018 and Endgame in 2019.

Both Avengers films even have glowing ratings on Rotten Tomatoes. Infinity War earned an 85 percent rating from critics and 92 percent from audiences, while Endgame earned 94 percent from critics and 90 percent from audiences.

Both critics and audiences agreed that the two Avengers movies managed to build and resolve the climactic story of the Marvel superheroes gathering while showing their human side.

After finishing Avengers: Endgame, Joe and Anthony Russo were never again involved in MCU projects, either movies or series. They focused on working on other box office films, such as Cherry (2021) and The Gray Man (2022).

Meanwhile, the fifth Avengers movie was previously titled The Kang Dynasty which focuses on the current main MCU villain, Kang, played by Jonathan Majors.

However, Marvel terminated Majors' contract after the actor was found guilty in a violence and harassment case against his ex-girlfriend.

Avengers: The Kang Dynasty had also previously engaged Destin Daniel Cretton as director. However, the director pulled out of the project.

Meanwhile, the sixth Avengers movie is titled Secret Wars. However, the vacant director's chair for the project opened the opportunity for the Russo Brothers to fill the role.

How Long Does it Take to Get to the Moon from Earth in a Rocket and Back?

How Long Does it Take to Get to the Moon from Earth in a Rocket and Back?

The moon has always been a source of fascination for humans.

The moon has always been a source of fascination for humans. Its silvery glow in the night sky. The Moon has captured our imaginations for centuries. But have you ever wondered how long does it take to get to the Moon from Earth? This article will explore the details of this cosmic journey. Let's check out some travel to tell you how long it takes to get to the Moon from Earth, compiled from numerous sources, on Monday (02/10/2023).

THE DISTANCE TO THE MOON

Before finding out how long it takes to get to the Moon, we must understand the distance between our home planet and its natural satellite. On average, the Moon is about 238,855 miles (384,400 kilometers) away from Earth. This distance can vary slightly due to the Moon's elliptical orbit.
Photo: nasa-unsplash

The time it takes to get to the Moon depends on the speed and orbit of the spacecraft used for the journey. Historically, there have been various missions to the Moon, but we'll focus on one of the most iconic ones: the Apollo program.

TRAVELING TO THE MOON

pexels-pixabay-

APOLLO MISSIONS

During the Apollo program in the 1960s and 1970s, NASA sent astronauts to the Moon. The spacecraft used for these missions were the Apollo Command/Service Module (CSM) and the Lunar Module (LM). Here's a simplified breakdown of the journey:

How Long Does it Take to Get to the Moon from Earth in a Rocket and Back?

Travelling to the Moon and back in a rocket involves several stages and a round trip. Let's break down the timeline for a typical journey to the Moon and back using a rocket.

How Long Does it Take to Get to the Moon

Stage 1: Launch from Earth

The journey starts with the launch from the Earth's surface. This involves a powerful rocket, which carries the spacecraft into space. The most famous example is the Saturn V rocket. This was used during the Apollo program. The launch phase lasts for just a few minutes, during which the rocket steps up fast to break free from Earth's gravitational pull.

Duration: About 8-10 minutes

After reaching Earth's orbit, the rocket's upper stage or the spacecraft's machines fire again to increase speed. This critical maneuver is called Translunar Injection (TLI). It moves the spacecraft from Earth's orbit onto an orbit towards the Moon.

Duration: About 10 minutes

Stage 2: Translunar Injection (TLI)

Stage 3: Cruise to the Moon

Duration: Around 3 days

Stage 3

With TLI completed, our rocket enters a coasting phase as it heads toward the Moon. This part of the journey is often called the "cruise phase." The spacecraft's engines are not firing during this time. It takes several days to reach the Moon. The exact duration depends on the speed and rotation chosen for the mission.

Upon entering the Moon's area, the rocket enters lunar orbit. It orbits the Moon for a certain period, which allows for careful planning of lunar descent and exploration activities. The time spent in lunar orbit can vary, but it's typically a matter of days.

Duration: Variable (usually a few days).

Stage 4: Lunar Orbit

nasa-unsplash

Stage 5: Lunar Descent and Exploration

Once in lunar orbit, astronauts (if onboard) transfer to the Lunar Module (LM), which separates from the Command/Service Module (CSM). The LM descends to the lunar surface. The lunar comedown and exploration duration depend on the specific mission. This objective can last several hours.
Duration: Variable (several hours).

Stage 6: Ascent from the Moon

After completing their activities on the moon's surface, astronauts rise up from the Moon in the LM to meet with the CSM in lunar orbit. This phase takes a few hours to complete.

Duration: Several hours

Photo: nasa-unsplash

The spacecraft leaves the moon's orbit and starts its journey back to Earth. Similar to the outbound journey, this involves a coasting phase where the spacecraft travels through space without releasing its engines. The duration of the return journey is around the same as the outbound journey, taking about three days.

Duration: About 3 days

Stage 7: Return Journey to Earth

Stage 8: Reentry and Splashdown

As the spacecraft comes to Earth, it must go through the reentry phase, where it reenters Earth's atmosphere. Heat protection contrasts with the extreme heat caused during reentry. Parachutes are open to slow down the spacecraft for a gentle splashdown in the ocean.

Duration: About 30 minutes (reentry and splashdown).

In total, an Apollo mission to the Moon typically lasted about 8 to 12 days. The actual time spent traveling from Earth to the Moon was around three days each way, with the rest of the mission dedicated to lunar orbit, exploration, and the return journey.

Total Travel Time

It's important to note how long does it take to get to the Moon. Advances in technology and space travel may change these travel times in the future.

Modern spacecraft may be qualified for faster travel, but the essential principles of space travel, such as escaping Earth's gravity and guiding the vast expanse of space, will stay constant.

How Long Does it Take to Get to the Moon

So, when you gaze at the Moon in the night sky, remember that going to it is a journey of science and determination, taking several days to complete. 

While the Apollo missions are proof of human achievement. They are just the opening to our exploration of the Moon and beyond. As technology advances, we may make the journey in less time. But for now, we can only marvel at the Moon from afar and dream of future missions to come.

50 Disappointment Quotes: Inspirational And Deep Words To Cheer You Up

Are you feeling down and disappointed after failing to achieve your goal, or is everything not going according to your plan? Don't worry; we're here to help you get back on your feet. In this article, we will share some great disappointment quotes that will help cheer you up.

50 Disappointment Quotes: Inspirational And Deep Words To Cheer You Up

In the journey of life, disappointment is an inevitable companion that often arrives uninvited. It's a sentiment that everyone encounters at some point, and it can be a challenging emotion to grapple with.

Disappointment doesn't discriminate; it can happen in various aspects of life, from personal relationships to professional endeavors. This collection of disappointment quotes serves as a reflection on the universal human experience of facing setbacks and unmet expectations.

Disappointment Quotes

In this article, we have gathered some of the best disappointment quotes from various sources, Friday (17/11/2023). Whether you're seeking comfort after a personal letdown or searching for wisdom to navigate professional challenges, these quotes offer insight into the nature of disappointment and provide an extra boost of motivation to get back on your feet.

A. Inspirational Disappointment Quotes

1. "The size of your success is measured by the strength of your desire; the size of your dream; and how you handle disappointment along the way." - Robert Kiyosaki

2. "You may be disappointed if you fail, but you are doomed if you don't try." - Beverly Sills

3. "We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope." - Martin Luther King, Jr.

4. "Anytime you suffer a setback or disappointment, put your head down and plow ahead." - Les Brown

5. "Men's best successes come after their disappointments." - Henry Ward Beecher

6. "We must all suffer one of two things: the pain of discipline or the pain of regret or disappointment." - Jim Rohn

7. "Young alienation, disappointment and heartache is all a part of the first real growing up that we do." - Judd Nelson

8. "There's always failure. And there's always disappointment. And there's always loss. But the secret is learning from the loss, and realizing that none of those holes are vacuums." - Michael J. Fox

9. "Disappointment is the nurse of wisdom." - Boyle Roche

10. "If we will be quiet and ready enough, we shall find compensation in every disappointment."

- Henry David Thoreau

11. "See your disappointments as good fortune. One plan's deflation is another's inflation." - Jean Cocteau

12. "One's best success comes after their greatest disappointments." - Henry Ward Beecher

13. "Disappointments are just God's way to saying 'I've got something better'. Be patient, live life, have faith." - Unknown

14. "Disappointment is a sign that you are growing and progressing. Stay hopeful and determined. Your best days are still ahead." - Unknown

15. "Remember that sometimes not getting what you want is a wonderful stroke of luck." - Dalai Lama

16. "The best way to deal with disappointment is to acknowledge and work through the feelings it induces." - Noaman Kaysingwala

17. "Our role as leaders is to turn away from our disappointment and abandonment, and give ourselves to those with whom we still have influence." - Costa Mitchell

18. "Don't blame people for disappointing you, blame yourself for expecting too much from them." - Unknown

19. "Don't ever let a bad day make you feel like you'll have a bad life." - Unknown

20. "Most things disappoint till you look deeper." - Graham Greene

21. "Disappointments are not meant to destroy you; they are meant to strengthen you." - Unknown

22. "Understanding is the key to getting over disappointment." - Unknown

23. "When someone disappoints you, there is nothing that can be done but to accept it." - Unknown

24. "Struggle and disappointment are necessary ingredients to success both in the present and in the future." - Britney Watkins

25. "To courageously straighten up again after our heads have been bowed by defeat, disappointment and suffering is a supreme test of character." - Wilferd Peterson

B. Deep Disappointment Quotes

1. "Disappointment is an endless wellspring of comedy inspiration." - Martin Freeman

2. "Disappointments are inevitable; discouragement is a choice." - Charles Stanley

3. "There can be no deep disappointment where there is not deep love." - Martin Luther King, Jr.

4. "The beauty is that through disappointment you can gain clarity, and with clarity comes conviction and true originality." - Conan O'Brien

7 Great Inspirational Movies That Will Make You Feel Motivated

7 Great Inspirational Movies That Will Make You Feel Motivated

Have you ever watched a movie that left you feeling inspired and motivated? There are many films out there that can lift your spirits and ignite a fire within you. Whether it's a true story of triumph over adversity, a tale of personal growth, or a heartwarming journey of hope and resilience, inspirational movies have the power to move us in ways that few other forms of entertainment can.

In this article, we'll take a look at some of the best inspirational movies that will pimp up your spirit and push you to overcome your boundaries.

1. Pursuit of Happyness (2006)

Will Smith stars in the heartfelt story of Chris Gardner, a man determined to overcome life's challenges and build a better future for himself and his son. The movie reminds us that no matter how tough the journey, perseverance, and hard work can lead to a brighter tomorrow.

2. Rocky (1976)

Sylvester Stallone's iconic portrayal of Rocky Balboa embodies the spirit of an underdog fighting against the odds.

This classic sports drama teaches us about the value of hard work, dedication, and the unshakeable human spirit.

It shows us that success is not just about winning but about giving your best effort.

Tom Hanks takes us through the extraordinary life of Forrest Gump, a man with a simple mind and an extraordinary heart.

3. Forrest Gump (1994)

The film emphasizes the power of kindness, perseverance, and the ability to overcome obstacles. It shows that anyone can make a significant difference in the world.

4. Champions (2023)

This heartwarming tale follows Marcus Marakovich. He is a hot-tempered assistant coach forced into community service with a basketball team for individuals with learning disabilities.

As Marcus navigates personal and professional challenges, he discovers the true meaning of teamwork and the extraordinary potential that resides in each individual.

5. Yes Man! (2008)

Jim Carrey stars in this comedic yet meaningful film that explores the impact of embracing new opportunities. By adopting a positive and open-minded attitude, he learns the importance of saying "yes" to life's possibilities and how this small and simple thing can change his life forever.

However, this movie also reminds us that not all opportunities should be taken.

6. Good Will Hunting (1997)

Matt Damon and Robin Williams deliver powerful performances in this thought-provoking film about self-discovery and personal growth.

Good Will Hunting explores the transformative power of mentorship and the potential that lies within each of us, inspiring us to overcome our own limitations.

7. The Grapes of Wrath (1940)

Based on John Steinbeck's novel, this film portrays the struggles of the Joad family during the Great Depression.

It serves as a strong reminder of the strength that can be found in unity and the importance of resilience in the face of adversity. The Grapes of Wrath inspires us to stand firm in the face of challenges and work together for a better future.

A 100 Kg Bomb from the World War II Era Found in Singapore

A 100 Kg Bomb from the World War II Era Found in Singapore

A 100kg World War II-era aerial bomb was discovered last week at the Myst condominium construction site near Singapore's Cashew MRT station.

Bomb disposal experts from the Singapore Armed Forces (SAF) considered it unsafe to remove the relic. So, a "controlled on-site disposal" will be done between 8 a.m. and 7 p.m. on Tuesday, September 26, 2023.

Hundreds of people living and working in parts of Bukit Timah Atas will have to evacuate their buildings before bomb disposal experts tackle the unexploded World War II relic on Tuesday.

Nearly 1,600 residents and stakeholders will be affected by the bomb disposal operation.

A 200-meter cordon will be set up around the area, and people in the following places must vacate before the operation begins.

Residents are asked to evacuate, leave their homes before 8 a.m. on Tuesday, and stick a green strip on their front doors when they go. The police provide these green strips for authorities to account for occupants in a building.

Residents are also urged to open windows and secure loose items. "This is a precautionary measure, as it is unlikely that any windows will break due to the difference in air pressure," Singapore police said in the letter.


The Senja-Mete community club will set up a shelter area for affected residents. Meanwhile, Greenridge Secondary School will switch to home-based learning on Tuesday, September 26.

To facilitate bomb disposal operations, Jalan Layang Bukit Panjang (between Jalan Woodlands and Jalan Petir) and Jalan Bukit Timah Atas (between Jalan Petir and Jalan Mete) will be closed to traffic from 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. Tuesday.

Traffic Police officers will be deployed to help direct motorists.

"Loud noises may be heard during the controlled disposal of the relics. The public is urged not to be alarmed and to avoid the area," the police added.

-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.meta_description: Dolphins are amazing animals with lot of surprising facts!
-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.content:
5 Surprising Facts about Dolphins

5 Surprising Facts About Dolphins

Dolphins are known to be friendly animals, especially for humans. Unlike shark, dolphins are usually shown as a smart and helpful animal.

Even so, this mammal isn't as good as it seems. There are several surprising facts about dolphins you must know.

Based on a study published in Proceedings: Biological Sciences in 1998, it was found that 5 juvenile bottlenose dolphins suffered fatal injuries due to attacks by adult males of the same species. It is later known that the adult males did that so the female dolphins are ready to do the mating process again.

Loves to kill younger dolphins

Not as innocent as they seem, dolphins are often violent and forceful when it comes to sex. For example, pods of two or three male bottlenose dolphins force females to mate, sometimes for weeks. If the female dolphin refuses, then the male will make intimidating sounds and commit violence by hitting his tail against the female's body.

Mating female dolphins by force

According to National Geographic, dolphins can stay awake for five days straight without losing their mental acuity. In fact, they must remain conscious even when they are sleeping. This is because dolphin breathing is not automatically controlled.

Could stay awake for days!

In the documentary series "Spy in the Pod", a group of dolphins are seen head-butting a pufferfish. Pufferfish are known to secrete spines and venom to protect themselves. Usually, animals will run away when the poison is released, but not these dolphins. In the video, the dolphin is seen flying and enjoying its own time.

Enjoying pufferfish poison

It is known that some animals can get sexually transmitted infections (STIs). According to HuffPost, one of them is the Atlantic bottlenose dolphin (Tursiops truncatus), which can have genital warts.

Some dolphins species are having sexual infections
