5 Most Romantic Places In Sweden For Couples

5 Most Romantic Places In Sweden For Couples

Sweden, known for its picturesque landscapes and charming cities, is a dream destination for couples looking to spend some quality time together.

From vibrant cities to tranquil natural settings, Sweden offers a variety of romantic places for couples to explore. Here are three of the most romantic places in Sweden for couples to visit:

1. Stockholm

Stockholm, the capital city of Sweden, is a romantic haven for couples. With its charming old town, picturesque waterfront, and beautiful parks, Stockholm offers plenty of opportunities for romantic walks and cozy moments. 

Take a stroll hand in hand through Gamla Stan, the historic heart of the city, and admire the colorful buildings, and cobblestone streets. Visit the Royal Palace, wander around Djurgården island, or take a boat cruise around the archipelago for a truly unforgettable experience.

Stockholm's world-class restaurants, trendy bars, and luxurious hotels also make it a perfect destination for a romantic weekend getaway.

For couples looking to escape the hustle and bustle of city life and immerse themselves in nature, Swedish Lapland is the perfect destination.

2. Swedish Lapland

This remote and pristine region in northern Sweden offers breathtaking landscapes, including snow-covered mountains, crystal-clear lakes, and the mesmerizing Northern Lights. 

Snuggle up together in a cozy log cabin, go dog sledding through the snow, or relax in a traditional sauna under the starlit sky.

Swedish Lapland is a place where you can truly connect with nature and each other, making it an ideal destination for a romantic retreat.

3. Gothenburg

Gothenburg, Sweden's second-largest city, is another romantic gem that shouldn't be missed. Known for its picturesque canals, lush parks, and vibrant cultural scene, Gothenburg offers plenty of romantic activities for couples.

Take a romantic canal cruise, explore the beautiful Botanical Garden, or enjoy a picnic in Slottsskogen Park.

Stroll hand in hand along the charming streets of Haga, visit the iconic Feskekôrka fish market, or indulge in a romantic dinner at one of the city's many cozy restaurants.

Gothenburg's relaxed and charming atmosphere makes it a perfect destination for couples looking to unwind and enjoy each other's company.

4. Gotland Island

Gotland is a charming island located off the southeastern coast of Sweden. Known for its stunning beaches, medieval ruins, and quaint villages, Gotland offers a peaceful and idyllic setting for couples looking to escape the hustle and bustle of city life.

Take a romantic stroll along the cobblestone streets of Visby, the island's main town, visit the iconic Gotland Art Museum, or simply relax on the sandy shores of Tofta Beach while watching the sunset over the Baltic Sea.

5. Skåne

Skåne, located in the southern part of Sweden, is known for its rolling hills, picturesque vineyards, and charming seaside towns.

Perfect for couples who enjoy outdoor activities, Skåne offers endless opportunities for romantic adventures such as hiking in Söderåsen National Park, cycling through the scenic countryside, or exploring the historic city of Malmö.

Visit the stunning Kullaberg Nature Reserve for breathtaking views of the coastline, indulge in a wine-tasting tour at one of Skåne's many wineries, or simply unwind and relax in a cozy bed and breakfast overlooking the serene Swedish countryside.

-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.title: Why Do People Get Defensive When Asked a Question? Understanding and Overcoming Defensiveness
-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.meta_description: This behavior is called defensiveness. It’s a common problem that can make talking to people difficult.
-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.content:
Why Do People Get Defensive When Asked a Question? Understanding and Overcoming Defensiveness

Have you ever asked someone a simple question, only to have them react angrily or try to change the subject? This behavior is called defensiveness. It’s a common problem that can make talking to people difficult. In this article, we’ll look at why people get defensive, how to spot it, and what to do about it. We’ll also learn ways to be less defensive ourselves and have better conversations with others.

What is Defensiveness?

Defensiveness is when someone reacts badly to feedback or questions. Instead of listening and thinking about what the other person said, they try to protect themselves. They might get angry, make excuses, or blame others. This happens because they feel attacked or criticized, even if that wasn’t the intent.

For example, imagine a wife tells her husband she’s sad he didn’t go to her work party. Instead of listening, he might say “Well, you never come to my work events!” This defensive response doesn’t solve the problem. It just makes both people feel worse.

Defensive people often have a hard time hearing feedback. They see questions or comments as attacks, even when the other person is just trying to talk or understand. This can make it very hard to have good conversations or solve problems together.

There are many reasons why someone might become defensive when asked a question:

• Fear of being wrong: Some people really don’t like admitting mistakes. Being asked about something makes them worry they’ll look bad.

• Low self-esteem: People who don’t feel good about themselves may see questions as criticism.

• Past experiences: If someone was often criticized or yelled at before, they might expect all questions to be attacks.

• Feeling threatened: Questions about certain topics might make a person feel their status or power is at risk.

• Shame or guilt: If someone feels bad about something they did, questions might make those feelings worse.

• Anxiety: Some people get very nervous when put on the spot. Questions make them feel pressured.

• Control issues: People who like being in charge may see questions as challenges to their authority.

Often, defensiveness comes from a place of insecurity or fear. The person isn’t really mad at the question. They’re afraid of what answering might mean about them. Understanding this can help us be more patient when dealing with defensive people.

Signs of Defensiveness

How can you tell if someone is being defensive? Here are some common signs:

• Getting angry or upset quickly

• Making excuses or blaming others

• Changing the subject

• Refusing to answer questions

• Using sarcasm or mean jokes

• Saying “you always” or “you never” a lot

• Bringing up old arguments

• Attacking the person asking questions

• Stonewalling (refusing to talk at all)

• Body language like crossing arms or rolling eyes

If you notice these behaviors in yourself or others during a conversation, defensiveness might be a problem. Being aware of these signs can help you address the issue before it gets worse.

Causes of Defensiveness

Defensiveness doesn’t just come from nowhere. It often has roots in a person’s past experiences and personality. Some common causes include:

• Childhood experiences: People who grew up with very critical parents might always expect criticism.

• Trauma: Past abuse or bullying can make people very protective of themselves.

• Personality traits: Some people are naturally more sensitive to criticism than others.

• Mental health issues: Conditions like anxiety or depression can increase defensiveness.

• Cultural factors: In some cultures, admitting mistakes is seen as very shameful.

• Work environment: Jobs with a lot of pressure or blame can make people defensive.

• Relationship patterns: If arguing is normal in a relationship, defensiveness might become a habit.

Understanding these causes can help us be more compassionate when dealing with defensive people. It also helps us look at our own defensiveness and where it might come from.

Types of Defensiveness

Defensiveness can show up in different ways. Here are some common types:

• Attacking: Criticizing or insulting the person who asked the question.

• Deflecting: Changing the subject or bringing up unrelated issues.

• Justifying: Making excuses or explaining why something isn’t their fault.

• Minimizing: Saying the issue isn’t a big deal or doesn’t matter.

• Victimizing: Acting like they’re being unfairly picked on or attacked.

• Stonewalling: Refusing to engage in the conversation at all.

• Counterattacking: Pointing out the other person’s flaws or mistakes instead.

• Intellectualizing: Using big words or complex ideas to avoid the real issue.

Knowing these types can help you spot defensiveness in yourself and others. It also helps you choose the best way to respond to each type.

Impact of Defensiveness

Being defensive might feel good in the moment, but it can cause big problems over time:

• Relationship damage: Defensiveness pushes people away and makes it hard to be close.

• Communication breakdown: When people are defensive, real talks become impossible.

• Missed opportunities: Defensive people don’t learn from feedback or grow.

• Increased conflict: Defensiveness often leads to more arguments and fights.

• Emotional stress: Always being on guard is tiring and stressful.

• Work problems: Defensive employees have trouble working in teams or taking direction.

• Low self-esteem: Over time, being defensive can make people feel worse about themselves.

Recognizing these negative effects can motivate us to work on reducing defensiveness in our lives. It’s not easy, but the benefits are worth it.

How to Be Less Defensive

If you want to be less defensive, try these tips:

• Pause before responding: Take a deep breath and think before you speak.

• Listen actively: Really try to understand what the other person is saying.

• Ask questions: If you’re not sure, ask for more information instead of assuming.

• Acknowledge feelings: It’s okay to say “I feel hurt” or “That makes me nervous.”

• Look for truth: Even if you disagree, is there any part of the feedback that might be right?

• Practice self-compassion: Remember that everyone makes mistakes. It doesn’t make you a bad person.

• Focus on solutions: Instead of arguing about who’s right, think about how to fix the problem.

• Take breaks: If you feel yourself getting too upset, it’s okay to ask for a time-out.

Remember, changing habits takes time. Be patient with yourself as you learn to be less defensive.

How to Stop Making Others Defensive

Sometimes, the way we ask questions or give feedback can make others defensive. Here’s how to avoid that:

• Use “I” statements: Say “I feel” or “I think” instead of “You always” or “You never.”

• Be specific: Talk about one situation, not general patterns.

• Stay calm: If you’re angry or upset, the other person is more likely to get defensive.

• Ask, don’t accuse: “Can you help me understand?” is better than “Why did you do that?”

• Offer solutions: Don’t just point out problems. Suggest ways to fix them.

• Show empathy: Try to see things from their point of view.

• Give positive feedback too: Don’t only point out mistakes. Notice good things as well.

• Choose the right time: Don’t bring up issues when someone is tired or stressed.

By communicating in a more thoughtful way, we can reduce defensiveness in our conversations and relationships.

How to Respond to Defensive People

When someone gets defensive, it’s easy to get frustrated. But there are better ways to handle it:

• Stay calm: Don’t let their defensiveness make you upset too.

• Validate feelings: Say “I understand this is hard to talk about” or “I can see you’re upset.”

• Reframe the conversation: “I’m not attacking you. I just want to understand.”

• Ask for their perspective: “How do you see this situation?”

• Look for common ground: Find something you both agree on.

• Take breaks: If things get too heated, suggest talking later when you’re both calmer.

• Focus on the future: Instead of arguing about the past, talk about how to move forward.

• Consider therapy: If defensiveness is a big problem in a relationship, a counselor can help.

Remember, you can’t control how others react. But by staying calm and compassionate, you can often turn a defensive conversation into a productive one.

Overcoming Defensiveness in Relationships

Defensiveness can be especially harmful in close relationships. Here are ways to work on it together:

• Set ground rules: Agree on how to have difficult conversations before they happen.

• Use “time outs”: Have a signal for when either person needs a break from talking.

• Practice active listening: Take turns speaking and repeating back what you heard.

• Identify triggers: Talk about what topics or situations tend to cause defensiveness.

• Celebrate progress: Notice and appreciate when either person handles a situation well.

• Be patient: Changing communication habits takes time. Don’t expect perfection right away.

• Focus on teamwork: Remember you’re on the same side, not enemies.

• Seek help if needed: A couples counselor can teach techniques for better communication.

By working together to reduce defensiveness, couples can build stronger, more honest relationships.

Self-Reflection Questions for Defensiveness

To understand your own defensiveness better, ask yourself these questions:

• What situations or topics usually make me feel defensive?

• What am I afraid might happen if I admit to being wrong?

• How does my body feel when I’m getting defensive?

• What negative self-talk do I hear in my head when criticized?

• How did my family handle conflicts or mistakes when I was growing up?

• What would it look like to respond with curiosity instead of defensiveness?

• How has being defensive affected my relationships?

• What’s one small step I could take to be less defensive this week?

Thinking about these questions can help you understand the roots of your defensiveness and start to change it.

Conclusion

Defensiveness is a common reaction when we feel threatened or criticized. But it often makes situations worse, not better. By understanding why we get defensive and learning new ways to respond, we can have healthier conversations and relationships.

Remember, it’s okay to feel hurt or upset sometimes. The key is learning to express those feelings in a way that solves problems instead of creating new ones. With practice and patience, anyone can become less defensive and more open to feedback and questions.

Whether you’re dealing with your own defensiveness or trying to communicate with someone who’s defensive, the tips in this article can help. Keep working on it, and you’ll see improvements in your conversations and relationships over time.

8 Most Romantic Places in Netherlands (You Might Not Know About)

8 Most Romantic Places in Netherlands (You Might Not Know About)

Valentine's Day is nearing, and instead of the usual romantic spots, let's consider lesser-known places in the Netherlands. While Paris, Rome, and Venice are charming, the Netherlands has its own romantic gems perfect for celebrating love. Here we listed eight of the most romantic places in the Netherlands that you might not know about yet. Check them out!

Janskerkhof Flower Market

On Saturdays, Janskerkhof in Utrecht turns into a colorful Flower Market. Get roses for your Valentine or capture cute moments with vibrant flowers in the background.

Giethoorn - 'Venice of the Netherlands'

Known as the 'Venice of the Netherlands,' Giethoorn is a car-free village in Overijssel. Take a boat trip through its charming waterways for a fairytale-like experience.

Kinderdijk Windmills

Kinderdijk near Rotterdam, a UNESCO site, boasts 19 windmills symbolizing Dutch water management. Take a walk and soak in the postcard-perfect Netherlands.

Limburg Vineyards

Limburg offers lovely vineyards like Wijngaard Apostelhoeve. Enjoy wine tasting tours and pair it with a visit to Maastricht.

Maastricht's Fairytale Vibes

Maastricht, an ancient city, surprises with fairytale charm. Walk cobblestone streets, along the Meuse river, and explore castles. Easily accessible by train from Amsterdam.

'de Biesbosch' National Park

De Biesbosch National Park offers tranquility. Go for a walk, boat trip, or canoeing in this peaceful setting.

Noordwijk Beach in Winter

Noordwijk, near Leiden, transforms into a serene winter escape. Walk through dunes, enjoy soup at beachside restaurants, and relax in wellness hotels.

The Wadden Islands Adventure

Explore the Wadden Islands along the north side of the Netherlands. Enjoy walks on Dutch beaches and end with hot chocolate and apple pie. A picturesque setting for Valentine's Day.

For 20 years, a man in Japan named Otou Katayama didn't talk to his wife, Yumi.

He felt upset that she spent more time with their kids. 

Even though they lived together with their three children, Otou stayed silent, just nodding or grunting when Yumi tried to talk to him.

Top 5 Most Expensive Dog Breeds As Pet

These breeds are considered expensive not only due to their initial purchase price but also because of their maintenance costs,

Top 5 Most Expensive Dog Breeds As Pet

The Tibetan Mastiff is one of the most expensive dog breeds in the world. Originating from the Himalayan regions, these large, powerful dogs were historically used to protect livestock from predators. Tibetan Mastiffs have a distinctive, thick double coat that protects them from harsh climates. They are known for their independence, loyalty, and protective nature, making them excellent guard dogs.

The cost of a Tibetan Mastiff can range from $2,000 to $10,000, with some purebred puppies fetching even higher prices, particularly in China where they are highly prized.

Tibetan Mastiff

The Samoyed is a beautiful, fluffy breed known for its friendly and gentle demeanor. Originating from Siberia, these dogs were bred to herd reindeer and pull sleds in harsh, cold environments. They have a thick, white double coat that requires regular grooming. Samoyeds are sociable, playful, and good with children, making them excellent family pets.

Due to their striking appearance and pleasant temperament, Samoyeds can be quite expensive, with prices typically ranging from $3,000 to $8,000 for a well-bred puppy.

Samoyed

The Chow Chow is an ancient breed from China, recognizable by its lion-like mane and unique blue-black tongue. These dogs are known for their dignified and aloof nature, often forming strong bonds with their owners while being reserved with strangers. Chow Chows have a thick double coat that comes in various colors and requires regular grooming to maintain.

They are relatively independent and can be territorial, making early socialization important. A Chow Chow puppy can cost between $3,000 and $8,500, depending on the pedigree and breeder.

Chow Chow

English Bulldogs, with their distinctive wrinkled face and stocky build, are beloved for their gentle and affectionate nature. Despite their somewhat intimidating appearance, Bulldogs are friendly, loyal, and excellent with children. They have a short, smooth coat that is relatively easy to care for, though they are prone to certain health issues due to their brachycephalic (short-nosed) structure.

The cost of an English Bulldog puppy can range from $2,500 to $9,000, with some show-quality dogs fetching even higher prices due to their pedigree and lineage.

English Bulldog

The Löwchen, also known as the "Little Lion Dog," is a small, rare breed known for its cheerful and lively personality. Originating in Europe, Löwchens were popular among nobility during the Renaissance. They have a long, flowing coat that is often clipped to resemble a lion's mane, hence the name.

Löwchens are friendly, affectionate, and good with children, making them excellent companion pets. Due to their rarity and charming demeanor, Löwchen puppies can be quite expensive, with prices typically ranging from $4,000 to $8,000.

Löwchen

How To Whistle With Your Fingers: 3 Simple Techniques

Do you ever wonder how to whistle with your fingers, making those cool whistling sounds that seem like magic? Well, guess what? You can do it too!

How To Whistle With Your Fingers: 3 Simple Techniques

Whistling with your fingers is like having your own secret superpower. It's fun, it's fascinating, and it's something you can learn no matter how old you are.

In this article, we're going to take you on a journey into the world of finger whistling, and we promise it's going to be a blast!

© 2023 trstdly.com

You might think, "Whistling sounds complicated," but don't worry – we're here to guide you step by step through different ways to do it. Imagine being able to whistle your favorite tunes, call your pet, or get someone's attention in a fun and unique way. Whether you're a kid or a grown-up, this skill is for everyone.

In this article, we'll show you several techniques on how to whistle with your fingers. We gathered the guide from various sources, Wednesday (4/10/2023).

This is the most common technique where you use your thumb and forefinger to create a small opening for the air to pass through while your lips are puckered.

A. Thumb and Forefinger Whistle:

1. To get a good seal, start by wetting your lips slightly. You can lick them or use a damp cloth.

2. Hold your hand up with your palm facing you. Then, place the tip of your thumb and the tip of your forefinger together to create a small circle or "OK" sign.

3. With your fingers in the circle, position them horizontally in front of your mouth. The tips of your fingers should lightly touch your lips, with your thumb on top and your forefinger underneath.

4. Tuck your lips slightly over your teeth, keeping them relaxed but firm. Your lips should cover the space between your thumb and forefinger, leaving a small gap in the center.

5. Create a small gap between your tongue and the roof of your mouth, just behind your front teeth. This gap is where the air will flow through.

6. Pucker your lips slightly around your fingers to create a seal. This seal is essential for generating the whistling sound.

7. With your fingers in your mouth and your lips forming a seal, blow a steady stream of air through the gap between your fingers and over your tongue. Adjust the shape of your lips and the position of your fingers until you produce a clear whistle.

8. Whistling with your fingers may take some practice. Experiment with the angle, finger positioning, and lip tension until you find the combination that works best for you.

B. Two-Finger Whistle

Instead of using just your thumb and forefinger, you can use your thumb and the middle finger of the same hand to create a larger opening. The basic principles of lip and tongue positioning remain the same. (Image by 8photo on Freepik)

1. Just like with the thumb and forefinger whistle, start by wetting your lips slightly to help create a good seal.

2. Decide which two fingers you want to use. Many people prefer using the thumb and the middle finger, but you can experiment with different combinations to find what works best for you.

3. Place the two chosen fingers together to form a small circle or "OK" sign, just like in the thumb and forefinger whistle technique. The tips of your fingers should be touching.

4. Hold your fingers horizontally in front of your mouth, with the tips touching your lips.

5. Tuck your lips slightly over your teeth, keeping them relaxed but firm. Your lips should cover the space between your two fingers, leaving a small gap in the center.

6. Create a small gap between your tongue and the roof of your mouth, just behind your front teeth. This gap is where the air will flow through.

7. Pucker your lips slightly around your two fingers to create a seal. This seal is essential for generating the whistling sound.

8. With your fingers in your mouth and your lips forming a seal, blow a steady stream of air through the gap between your two fingers and over your tongue.

Adjust the shape of your lips and the position of your fingers until you produce a clear whistle.

© 2023 trstdly.com

Some people find it easier to whistle by using their pinky finger along with the thumb, forming a smaller, more precise opening.

C. Pinky Whistle

1. Start by wetting your lips slightly to create a good seal, as with the other whistling techniques.

2. For the Pinky Whistle, you'll be using just your pinky finger. Make sure your pinky is clean and dry.

3. Hold your pinky finger out and curl it into a small, tight loop, similar to the letter "C" but smaller.

4. Place your curled pinky finger horizontally in front of your mouth, with the tip of your pinky touching your lips.

5. Tuck your lips slightly over your teeth, keeping them relaxed but firm. Your lips should cover the space between your pinky finger, leaving a small gap in the center.

6. Create a small gap between your tongue and the roof of your mouth, just behind your front teeth. This gap is where the air will flow through.

7. Pucker your lips slightly around your pinky finger to create a seal. This seal is crucial for generating the whistling sound.

8. With your pinky finger in your mouth and your lips forming a seal, blow a steady stream of air through the gap between your pinky finger and over your tongue. Adjust the shape of your lips and the position of your pinky finger until you produce a clear whistle.

Tips For Choosing Unique Gaming Names

Choosing a unique gaming name is also known as a gamer tag or username. Gaming name is an important part of creating your online gaming identity. Here are some tips to help you pick a memorable and unique gaming name:

1. Uniqueness is Key: Your gaming name should be unique and not easily confused with other players. Avoid using common names, popular phrases, or well-known character names.

2. Avoid Numbers and Special Characters: Avoid using numbers or special characters in your name if possible. They can make your name less memorable and harder to communicate.

3. Keep It Short and Simple: Short names are easier to remember and type. Aim for a name that's short and specific.

Tips

4. Avoid Harsh or Unpolite Content: Steer clear of offensive, controversial, or unsuitable words or references in your gaming name. Keep it respectful.

5. Personal Interests: Consider incorporating your hobbies, favorite games, or interests into your username. This can make your name more meaningful and memorable.

6. Random Generators: If you're stuck, try using random name generators. They can provide ideas that you might not have thought of.

7. Name Pronunciation: Think about how your name will sound when spoken by others. A name that's easy to pronounce can help others remember it.

8. Check Availability: Before settling on a name, search to see if it's already in use on the gaming platform you plan to use. If it's taken, you'll need to create an alternative.

Tips

9. Consider the Game Theme: Some games have themes or settings that can inspire your gaming name. For example, if you're playing a fantasy game, choose a name that fits the fantasy genre.

10. Memorable and Catchy: A good gaming name is one that sticks in people's minds. Think of something catchy, fun, or fascinating.

11. Use Wordplay: Consider using wordplay, puns, or clever combinations of words to create a unique and interesting gaming name.

12. Be Consistent: If you plan to play across multiple platforms, it can be helpful to choose a gaming name that you can use always to build your gaming identity.

13. Consider Future Growth: Think about whether your chosen name will still reflect your identity and interests as you continue gaming in the future.

14. Ask for Feedback: Don't hesitate to ask friends or fellow gamers for their opinions on likely unique gaming names. They may offer insights or ideas you hadn't thought.

15. Create Alternatives: Have a list of alternative names ready in case your first choice is already taken. This can save time when registering on gaming platforms.

Remember that your gaming name is a reflection of your gaming persona. So take your time choosing one you'll be happy with in the long run.

A memorable and unique gaming name can set you apart in the gaming community. This name will help you build a strong online presence.

-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.content:
Henry Cavill Gets Stomachache After Smoking 8 Hours in Deadpool & Wolverine

Henry Cavill Gets Stomachache After Smoking 8 Hours in Deadpool & Wolverine

Henry Cavill's special cameo appearance in Deadpool & Wolverine holds a lot of stories. Even though he only appears for a few seconds, he still seems in totality as a Wolverine variant nicknamed Cavillrine.

In his interview with The New York Times, Shawn Levy shared stories about their filming process. The director said the former Superman was very intent on appearing there and did not mind smoking cigars, even in large quantities.

"(Henry Cavill) not only had a full, muscular body, but also kept lighting up cigars and chewing on them during the shoot," Levy said.

"I remember hearing the next day that Henry was feeling queasy and nauseous because he had smoked cigars for eight hours straight, but never once did he falter."

Henry Cavill's appearance in the movie had been targeted by him and Ryan Reynolds for quite some time. It was realized after he was fired from DC.

"Given Deadpool's constant dialogue with culture, it felt like a great opportunity to first cast Henry Cavill in a role that he would play really well, but also to poke fun at other comic book-based movie studios and play with the self-awareness there," he explains.

Shawn Levy was involved in working on the script with Ryan Reynolds, writers of previous Deadpool films Rhett Reese and Paul Wernick, and comic book writer Zeb Wells.

He emphasized how Disney and Feige gave them 'creative autonomy' in bringing Deadpool's unique flavor to a large corporation in a typically family-friendly entertainment industry.

"I really want to underline that because, as a fan of the MCU, I remember hearing rumors about how much control directors get at Marvel," said the director.

"They produce so many hits. What's their magic inside that myth-making factory? I didn't know any of that, and I probably went in a little scared, but this movie - by far the biggest movie I've ever seen, that I've ever made - it's probably the most creative freedom I've ever had," he asserts.

This also positively impacted Disney as they added to the company's coffers. Deadpool & Wolverine itself has grossed US$824 million globally.

This number has also surpassed the other two Deadpool films, where in 2016, they earned US$783 million, and in 2018, they collected US$786 million.

-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.meta_description: Self-esteem quotes remind us we're strong, intelligent, and worthy of love. They can come from various people, like famous authors, philosophers.
-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.content:
Self esteem quotes to Help Discover Your Value

Like a best friend, these quotes help us see the good things about ourselves when we're feeling down.

Self esteem quotes to Help Discover Your Value

Self-esteem is all about how we feel about ourselves. We believe in our worth and feel confident when we have good self-esteem.


But sometimes, our self-esteem can tremble when we face struggles or criticism. That's when self-esteem quotes come to recovery!





Self esteem quotes

Self-esteem quotes remind us we're strong, intelligent, and worthy of love. They can come from various people, like famous authors, philosophers, or even movie characters. Like a best friend, they help us see the good things about ourselves when feeling down.

Let’s look at some powerful self-esteem quotes and see how they can improve our confidence!

Self-esteem Quotes


• “Low self-esteem involves imagining the worst that other people can think about you.” —Roger Ebert

• “The single most powerful way to build confidence is to act with the confidence you aspire to have.” —Margie Warrell

Self esteem quotes

“Quiet that voice of doubt inside of you. You are good enough. You do deserve good things. You are smart enough. You are worthy of love and respect. You are amazing just the way you are.” —Lorri Faye

• “Confidence is a habit that can be developed by acting as if you already had the confidence you desire to have.” —Brian Tracy

• “Low self-esteem: when every compliment sounds sarcastic.” —Unknown

• “Once you embrace your value, talents, and strengths, it neutralizes when others think less of you.” —Rob Liano

• “Many of us seek to ‘have’ self-esteem, but self-esteem is hard to ‘have’ because it’s based mostly on things that change.” —Christina Hibbert

• “I refuse to follow the rules where society tries to control people with low self-esteem.” —Kanye West

• “People with low self esteem are less self-confident and have more negative thoughts and feelings about themselves.” —Hailey Shafir

• “Wanting to be someone else is a waste of the person you are.” —Marilyn Monroe

• “Feeling good enough is not just about letting go of your insecurities and gaining healthy self-esteem. Actually having a healthy self-esteem is a gateway to further development.” —Marko Sander

• “Low self-esteem: when every compliment sounds sarcastic.” —Unknown

• “I need to work on my self-esteem. It’s very bruised.” —Lupindo

• “We’ve been told and taught to believe that there are things about us that make us unworthy.” —Julie Kristina

“If you have good self-confidence in one area but a lack of self-esteem, you are not likely to be happy.” —Jonny Pardoe

• “Deep down, everyone feels the same… at our core, we all just want to belong. We all just want to be loved.” —Christina Hibbert

• “Your success depends mainly upon what you think of yourself and whether you believe in yourself.” —William J. Boetcker

"The people who contributed to your sense of low self-esteem will be ashamed when God gets through unleashing you. You won’t have to prove anything. God will prove it.” —Unknown

• “There are so many factors around me that have made me question who I am, whether I’m doing the right thing, whether I am worthy enough.” —Self-Esteem Documentary

• “Knowing about the odd internal origins of self-esteem is crucial because of how often we pursue goals in the belief that success will, at last, give us the keys to feeling good about ourselves.” —The School Of Life

• “If I have lost confidence in myself, I have the universe against me.” —Ralph Waldo Emerson

• “External approval can temporarily boost your self-esteem, but ultimately keeps you trapped in the same cycle of relying on external validation to feel good about yourself.” —Hailey S.

• “Feeling good about who and how we are helps us feel good about life’s situations and other people, and helps us face challenges with confidence and compassion.” —Christina Hibbert

• “Whenever we are trying to do something on the outside… so what we can feel good about ourselves on the inside, it is a losing battle.” —Julie Kristina

• “If we want to fully experience love and belonging, we must believe we are worthy of love and belonging.” —Brene Brown

• “Sometimes people with low self-esteem will try to punish you for caring about them.” —Unknown

• “People with low self-esteem are more likely to sabotage themselves when good things happen to them, because they don’t feel deserving.” —Unknown

• “While everyone struggles with occasional dips in self-esteem, those who have chronically low self-esteem may actually be struggling with low self-worth.” —Hailey Shafir

• “I try to believe it, but deep down, I don’t feel my self-worth.” —Christina Hibbert

BLACKPINK's Lisa Announces Her Own Label, LLOUD

After Jennie, BLACKPINK's Lisa also started her own artist management company.

On February 8, Lisa announced on Instagram her new company, LLOUD. 

In her message, Lisa talked about her plans for LLOUD.

"This is LLOUD, a place where I can share ideas about music and entertainment. Come with me as we try new things together."

A post shared by LISA (@lalalalisa_m)

LLOUD’s official website describes the label as :

"At LLOUD, we want to create experiences that are more than just one type of music and can connect with a wide range of ages. We care deeply about being creative and real. We don't just break the rules; we change them, making music that tops the charts and doesn't fit in with one genre." 

Previously, the four BLACKPINK members agreed to stay with YG Entertainment for group projects.

Although Lisa is still with YG Entertainment for BLACKPINK work, LLOUD will handle her own projects.

60 Short Family Quotes: Touching Words That Will Warm Your Heart

60 Short Family Quotes: Touching Words That Will Warm Your Heart

Family is a special bond that can warm your heart in a way that nothing else can. Sometimes, the perfect way to capture the love and togetherness of a family is through short family quotes. These quotes are powerful in their simplicity and can evoke feelings of love, nostalgia, and happiness.

Short family quotes are like little nuggets of wisdom that can remind us of the importance of family and the joy that comes with being surrounded by loved ones. Whether it's a quote about the strength of family bonds, the joy of spending time together, or the support and love that family provides, these quotes have a way of touching our hearts in a profound way.

In this article, we have collected some of the most touchful short family quotes from various sources, Wednesday (3/1/2024). These magical words will warm your heart and remind you of your beloved family.

A. Heartwarming Short Family Quotes

1. "The love of a family is life's greatest blessing" - Eva Burrows

2. "Rejoice with your family in the beautiful land of life." - Albert Einstein

3. "What can you do to promote world peace? Go home and love your family." - Mother Teresa

4. "Family is not an important thing. It's everything." - Michael J. Fox

5. "Peace in society depends upon peace in the family." - Saint Augustine

6. "Other things may change us, but we start and end with the family." - Anthony Brandt

7. "The most important thing in the world is family and love." - John Wooden

8. "To us, family means putting your arms around each other and being there." - Barbara Bush

9. "The memories we make with our family is everything." - Candace Cameron Bure

10. "In time of test, family is best." - Burmese Proverb

11. "Family means no one gets left behind or forgotten." - David Ogden Stiers

12. "You don't choose your family. They are God's gift to you, as you are to them." - Desmond Tutu

13. "The family is one of nature's masterpieces." - George Santayana

14. "To care for those who once cared for us is one of the highest honors." - Tia Walker

15. "A happy family is but an earlier heaven." - George Bernard Shaw

16. "Family is family." - Linda Linney

17. "Everyone needs a house to live in, but a supportive family is what builds a home." - Anthony Liccione

18. "Many men can make a fortune but very few can build a family." - J.S. Bryan

19. "A happy family is but an earlier heaven." - George Bernard Shaw

20. "Family and friendships are two of the greatest facilitators of happiness." - John C. Maxwell

21. "The family is a haven in a heartless world." - Christopher Lasch

22. "Time together as a family is a gift." - Joanna Gaines

23. "Home isn't where you're from, it's where you find light when all grows dark." - Pierce Brown

24. "All happy families are alike." - Leo Tolstoy

25. "Sticking with your family is what makes it a family." - Mitch Albom

B. Funny Short Family Quotes

1. "A family is a bunch of people who keep confusing you with someone you were as a kid." - Robert Brault

2. "Having a family is like having a bowling alley installed in your brain." - Martin Mull

3. "A 2-year-old is kind of like having a blender, but you don't have a top for it." - Jerry Seinfeld

4. "Having one kid makes you a parent. Having two kids makes you a referee." - David Frost

5. "Being part of a family means smiling for photos." - Harry Morgan

6. "I grew up with six brothers. That's how I learned to dance—waiting for the bathroom." - Bob Hope

7. "Some family trees bear an enormous crop of nuts." - Wayne Huizenga

8. "As a child my family's menu consisted of two choices: take it or leave it." - Buddy Hackett

9. "Never underestimate a child's ability to get into more trouble." - Martin Mull

10. "Insanity runs in my family. It practically gallops." - Cary Grant
11. "Parents are not interested in justice, they're interested in peace and quiet." - Bill Cosby

12. "Families are like fudge—mostly sweet, with a few nuts." - Les Dawson

13. "There is no such thing as fun for the whole family.¨ - Jerry Seinfeld

14. "Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city." - George Burns

15. "Respect your parents. These guys pay for your internet." - Unknown

C. More Heartwarming Family Quotes

1. "Families are the compass that guides us. They are the inspiration to reach great heights, and our comfort when we occasionally falter." - Brad Henry

2. "I find the family the most mysterious and fascinating institution in the world." - Amos Oz

3. "When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching–they are your family." - Jim Butcher

4. "When all the dust is settled and all the crowds are gone, the things that matter are faith, family, and friends." - Barbara Bush

5. "Sister is probably the most competitive relationship within the family, but once the sisters are grown, it becomes the strongest relationship." - Margaret Mead

6. "It is the smile of a child, the love of a mother, the joy of a father, the togetherness of a family." - Menachem Begin

7. "So much of what is best in us is bound up in our love of family, that it remains the measure of our stability because it measures our sense of loyalty." - Haniel Long

8. "Family is family, whether it's the one you start out with the one you end up with, or the family you gain along the way." - Unknown

9. "Nothing is better than going home to family and eating good food and relaxing." - Irina Shayk

10. "Of all the rocks upon which we build our lives, we are reminded today that family is the most important." - Barack Obama

11. "If the family were a boat, it would be a canoe that makes no progress unless everyone paddles." - Letty Cottin Pogrebin

12. "Being a family means you are a part of something very wonderful. It means you will love and be loved for the rest of your life." - Lisa Weed

13. "The love of family and the admiration of friends are much more important than wealth and privilege." - Charles Kuralt

14. "Children can never have too many positive adult role models in their lives." - Unknown

15. "Parents were the only ones obligated to love you; from the rest of the world you had to earn it." - Ann Brashares

16. "When you look at your life, the greatest happinesses are family happinesses." - Joyce Brothers

17. "When trouble comes, it's your family that supports you." - Guy Lafleur

18. "In family life, love is the oil that eases friction, the cement that binds closer together, and the music that brings harmony." - Friedrich Nietzsche

19. "Family and friends are hidden treasures, seek them and enjoy their riches." - Wanda Hope Carter

20. "The family is the test of freedom; because the family is the only thing that the free man makes for himself and by himself." - Gilbert K. Chesterton

-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.title: The 12 Most Beautiful Ferrari Cars Ever Made
-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.meta_description: From the legendary Ferrari 250 GTO to the stunning Ferrari Monza, here are some of the most beautiful Ferrari cars ever made.
-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.content:
The 12 Most Beautiful Ferrari Cars Ever Made

Ferrari is one of the most famous makers of supercars in the world. Known for its fast cars, Ferrari also creates beautiful designs that look like works of art. Each model combines beauty and power, making them very popular with car lovers and collectors. The brand has a rich history and is known for its high quality and performance.

In this article, we will share some of the most beautiful Ferrari cars ever made in history.

1. Ferrari 250 GTO

The Ferrari 250 GTO is often seen as the most famous Ferrari. Built between 1962 and 1964, only 36 were made. Its smooth design and powerful V12 engine helped it win many races, including the 24 Hours of Le Mans and the Targa Florio. The GTO's shape is timeless, making it a true classic.

2. Ferrari 250 Testa Rossa

The 250 Testa Rossa was made from 1957 to 1961 and is known for its eye-catching side air vents and long hood. This car was designed for racing and achieved great success, including winning the Targa Florio in 1958. Its mix of elegance and speed makes it one of the most admired Ferraris.

3. Ferrari 246 GT Dino

The 246 GT Dino was produced from 1969 to 1974 and named after Enzo Ferrari's son, Dino. It has a unique design with smooth lines and a compact body. Powered by a V6 engine, it offers a blend of performance and style that attracts many fans.

4. Ferrari 365 GTB/4 Daytona

Launched in 1968, the Daytona is famous for its bold look and powerful V12 engine. Its long nose and wide stance give it an impressive presence on the road. This model combines luxury with high performance and has had success in racing events like the Daytona International Speedway race.

5. Ferrari Monza SP1/2

The Monza SP1 and SP2 are modern versions of classic Ferrari designs, introduced in 2018. These cars are known for their simple style and open-top design. Their unique shapes and advanced technology make them stand out as modern masterpieces.

6. Ferrari 288 GTO

Produced in the mid-1980s, the 288 GTO is known for its sporty look and turbocharged V8 engine. Inspired by the Ferrari 308 design, this car was built to compete in Group B. Its wide body and sharp lines create an aggressive appearance that captures attention.

7. Ferrari 250 GT Lusso

The Lusso, built from 1962 to 1964, is celebrated for its elegant curves and luxurious interior. It combines comfort with performance, making it perfect for long drives. While not a racing car, its classic design continues to inspire admiration among car enthusiasts.

8. Ferrari Enzo

Named after the founder Enzo Ferrari, this car was produced from 2002 to 2004. The Enzo features a modern design with sharp angles and a powerful V12 engine. It has a strong motorsport heritage but is more known for its road performance than race achievements.

9. Ferrari 250 GT California Spyder

The California Spyder is known for its beautiful convertible design and lightweight body. Produced in the late 1950s to the early 1960s, this model combines elegance with sporty performance. It became famous through movies like "Ferris Bueller's Day Off," adding to its appeal.

10. Ferrari Testarossa

Launched in the mid-1980s, the Testarossa is famous for its unique side strakes and wide rear end. Its powerful flat-12 engine provides impressive speed, while its bold design remains iconic in automotive history. The Testarossa is still celebrated by fans for its striking appearance.

11. Ferrari F50

The F50 was produced from 1995 to 1997 as a limited edition supercar. It features a race-inspired design with an open-top layout and a powerful V12 engine derived from Formula One technology. Its mix of performance and beauty makes it highly desirable among collectors.

12. Ferrari 458 Italia

Introduced in 2009, the 458 Italia is known for its stunning looks and advanced technology. With smooth lines and an aggressive stance, this car offers both beauty and high performance with its V8 engine. It quickly became popular among sports car enthusiasts around the world.

Dunkin Donut's Release Alcohol Drinks! How To Get It?

Dunkin has reportedly just released an alcoholic drink that consumers can enjoy.

Dunkin Donut's Release Alcohol Drinks! How To Get It?

Dunkin', formerly known as Dunkin' Donuts is one of the world's most famous fast food and beverage franchises. 

In addition to donuts, the Dunkin' franchise also releases soft drinks with various types and flavors.

Even now Dunkin has reportedly just released an alcoholic drink that consumers can enjoy.

Dunkin has released alcoholic beverages, including spiked coffee and iced tea pic.twitter.com/p3Cp2qofYn

— Dexerto (@Dexerto) March 28, 2024

Dunkin's alcoholic spiked iced teas and coffees will be available in 24 states.

As reported by Dexerto, Dunkin' has announced that their new spiked iced tea and coffee will be available in 24 states.

Even so, these drinks cannot be purchased at your local Dunkin' drive-thru.

However, according to the announcement from Dunkin', you can buy them at Kroger, Jewel, Binny's, and Meijer.

The iced tea has a 5% alcohol content and comes in four flavors: Slightly sweet, half and half, strawberry dragon and pineapple mango.

The iced coffee has a slightly higher ABV of 6% and is available in original, caramel, mocha and vanilla flavors.

Dunkin’ released a statement saying their spiked iced coffees and ice teas are the “perfect daytime or evening drinks that you can enjoy year-round.”

Travis Kelce's Ex-Girlfriend Kayla Nicole Can't Talk to the Kansas City Chiefs WAGs She Used to be Close To

Kayla Nicole, Travis Kelce's ex-girlfriend, recently expressed her frustration. After splitting from Kelce, she can not connect with the wives and girlfriends of Kansas City Chiefs players (WAGs).

Their five-year relationship ended in 2022. Since then, Kayla has distanced herself from the friends she once considered family, especially Brittany Mahomes, the wife of quarterback Patrick Mahomes.

Complex Relationships

During her time with Kelce, Kayla was close to several NFL colleagues, including Brittany Mahomes. However, after Kelce started dating Taylor Swift in 2023, Kayla unfollowed Brittany on social media, sparking speculation about their friendship.

Despite the public perception, Kayla said relationships are complex and don't just disappear overnight.

She mentioned that she had discussed the situation privately with Brittany. But she felt the need to protect herself in public.

Kayla and Travis

Besides discussing her friendship, Kayla has also been vocal about the rumors surrounding her breakup with Kelce. She has denied claims that their breakup was due to financial disagreements. She stated that such issues were never a concern in their relationship.

She and Travis have dismissed the rumors as baseless gossip circulating online.

Doritos Snack Set World Record For Longest Melting Cheese Pull!

Doritos Snack Set World Record For Longest Melting Cheese Pull!

Ever heard of a "cheese pull"? It's when you dip a chip into melted cheese, pull it out, and the cheese stretches as you munch on it.

Doritos, a famous chip brand from America, has a crazy idea to make a super big "cheese pull." that it breaks the world record!

It happened in England at Cheddar Gorge. They used a helicopter to dip a huge nacho chip into hot cheese, and it stretched for a whopping 15 meters without breaking!

People loved it and said it's like taking nachos to a whole new level!

"Cheese pulls" are a big hit on TikTok too, with the gooey cheese clips has been watched for more than 1,5 billion times.

7 Best Action-Comedy Movies for Thrills and Laughs

7 Best Action-Comedy Movies for Thrills and Laughs

When it comes to movies that combine action and comedy, there are some standout films that will have you laughing out loud while also keeping you on the edge of your seat.

These action-comedy movies are perfect for a movie night with friends or family, as they offer a perfect blend of excitement and humor. Let's take a look at some of the best action-comedy movies that are sure to make you laugh:

1. Thor: Ragnarok (2017)

(Available on: Disney+, Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

Thor: Ragnarok 

"Thor: Ragnarok" is a superhero film based on the Marvel Comics character Thor. Directed by Taika Waititi, this movie brings a fresh and comedic take on the character of Thor, played by Chris Hemsworth. With its witty dialogue, colorful visuals, and memorable characters like the Hulk and Loki, "Thor: Ragnarok" is a fun-filled adventure that will have you laughing from start to finish.

2. Kung Fu Hustle (2004)

(Available on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

Kung Fu Hustle 

"Kung Fu Hustle" is a martial arts action-comedy film directed by Stephen Chow, who also stars in the movie. Set in 1940s Shanghai, "Kung Fu Hustle" follows the story of a hapless wannabe gangster who discovers his hidden kung fu skills. Filled with over-the-top action sequences and slapstick humor, this movie is a wild ride that will have you chuckling at every turn.

3. Deadpool (2016)

(Available on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

Deadpool 

"Deadpool" is a superhero film starring Ryan Reynolds as the irreverent and wisecracking mercenary, Deadpool. Known for its dark humor, meta references, and R-rated action, "Deadpool" breaks the fourth wall and delivers laughs in a unique and unexpected way. With its fast-paced action and sarcastic wit, "Deadpool" is a must-watch for fans of action-comedy movies.

4. Rush Hour (1998)

(Available on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

Rush Hour

"Rush Hour" is an action-comedy film starring Jackie Chan and Chris Tucker as mismatched detectives who team up to solve a kidnapping case. Filled with high-octane action sequences and hilarious banter between the two leads, "Rush Hour" is a classic buddy cop movie that has stood the test of time. The chemistry between Jackie Chan and Chris Tucker is undeniable, making this film a crowd-pleaser for both action and comedy fans.

5. The Suicide Squad (2021)

(Available on: Netflix, Max, Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

The Suicide Squad 

"The Suicide Squad" is a superhero film directed by James Gunn, known for his work on the Guardians of the Galaxy movies. With its ensemble cast of colorful characters, including Harley Quinn and Bloodsport, "The Suicide Squad" is a wild and unpredictable ride filled with action and humor. James Gunn's signature style shines through in this film, delivering an entertaining mix of thrills and laughs.

6. Men in Black (1997)

(Available on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

Men in Black

"Men in Black" is a sci-fi action-comedy film starring Will Smith and Tommy Lee Jones as secret agents who monitor alien activity on Earth. With its clever blend of humor, science fiction elements, and slick action sequences, "Men in Black" is a fun and entertaining movie that has become a beloved classic. The chemistry between Will Smith and Tommy Lee Jones is the heart of the film, making it a joy to watch.

7. Shaolin Soccer (2001)

(Available on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

Shaolin Soccer

"Shaolin Soccer" is a sports action-comedy film directed by and starring Stephen Chow. Combining the worlds of martial arts and soccer, the movie follows a group of misfits who use their kung-fu skills to compete in a soccer tournament. Filled with outrageous special effects, slapstick humor, and heartwarming moments, Shaolin Soccer is a feel-good movie that will leave you smiling.

Japan's Hidden Horrors: 5 Scary Urban Legends You Need to Know

Japan is a land of ancient traditions and modern wonders. Japan is also home to a dark and chilling side.

Japan's Hidden Horrors: 5 Scary Urban Legends You Need to Know

This country is also filled with unsettling urban legends passed down through generations.

These tales of terror often blend folklore, history, and the supernatural. They create exciting histories that continue to haunt the imagination. In this article, we look at Japan's hidden horrors. We will explore five of the scariest urban legends you need to know. It ranges from the cursed Okiku Doll to the mysterious Teke-Teke. These stories will send shivers down your spine.

In the dimly lit corridors of the Mannenji Temple in Hokkaido, Japan, resides the Okiku doll. Okiku is an innocent-looking girl doll with long black hair. However, beneath her calm appearance lies a chilling legend. It is said that the spirit of a young girl named Okiku settled on the doll.

1. Okiku Doll: Haunted Doll

The tale goes that Okiku was a servant who cared deeply for her master's doll. When the doll's hair was accidentally cut, Okiku was blamed and met a tragic end. Her restless spirit is believed to reside in the doll, which reportedly grows human hair. Okiku doll has been the source of many supernatural happenings. Visitors claim to hear the doll's soft cries in the dead of night.
flickr/Duy Phạm Nhật

Hachishakusama, or "Eight Feet Tall," is a terrifying legend of a supernatural entity that preys on children. This spectral is a tall woman dressed in a white kimono.

2. Hachishakusama

She emerges every few decades to kidnap children. She is known for her height and the scary sound of her voice that echoes through the night.

Legend has been the issue of numerous sightings and ghostly encounters, with children reporting her scared presence near rice fields or in their bedrooms.

Scary Japan's Urban Legends

Kunekune is often referred to as the "Slenderman of Japan." Kunekune is a recent urban legend that has captured the imaginations of many. It is famous for its tall and faceless figure.

3. Kunekune: Slenderman Of Japan

Kunekune, wearing a trench coat, stalks rural areas. It is known for causing madness and paranoia in those who meet it.

The mere sight of Kunekune is said to lead to horrifying nightmares and hallucinations. This scare legend has gained popularity in the age of the internet. Kunekune serves as a cautionary tale about dangers.

The story is about a girl, Kashima Reiko. Her friends always make fun of her. One day, Kashima was with her friends after a school holiday.

4. Teke-Teke (Kashima Reiko)

They were standing near the railway tracks, waiting for the train to pass. Kashima's friends sarcastically scared her.

Kashima fell on the railway track. At the same time, a fast-passing train broke Kashima's body into two pieces.

Teke-Teke is also known as Kashima Reiko. Teke-Teke is a frightening tale of a vengeful spirit. Legend says a young woman was tragically cut up in a train accident. It resulted in her spirit returning as an evil force. Teke-Teke is said to have a torso that ends in a bloody stump.

She drags herself along the ground, making a distinctive "teke-teke" sound. She preys on easy victims. She often appears near railway tracks. Teke-Teke is known for chasing those who encounter her. This legend warns against playing near train tracks and the results of accidents.
Photo: youtube/Lupus Creepus

The Nure Onna, or "Snake Woman," is a demonic entity in Japanese folklore. This fearsome beast appears as a beautiful woman carrying a baby. She lures trustful travelers with her charm.

5. Nure Onna (Snake Woman)

Her true form is shown when her victims draw near—a monstrous snake with a scaled, twisted body. The Nure Onna plans to capture and eat her prey, leaving no trace behind. This legend is a warning tale about the dangers that lurk in the natural world.

Photo: Wikipedia

Japan's rich history and cultural tapestry have created many chilling urban legends. These tales continue to delight and terrify locals and those curious about the supernatural. 

These stories are rooted in tradition and passed down through generations. They offer a glimpse into the darker aspects of Japanese folklore. 

While many dismiss them as tales, there is absolute joy in entertaining the existence of these tales. These legends serve as cautionary tales. They teach us to tread carefully in the shadows and beware of the hidden horrors beyond our view.

Harley Quinn Quotes

Harley Quinn Quotes

23. “Psychologically speaking, vengeance rarely brings the catharsis we hope for.” (Birds of Prey and the Fantabulous Emancipation of One Harley Quinn, 2020)

32. "Do you know what a harlequin is? A harlequin’s role is to serve. It’s nothing without a master. And no one gives two sh*ts who we are beyond that."- Harley Quinn

33. "If you want boys to respect you, show them you’re serious. Shoot something, blow it up!" – Harley Quinn

34. "You made me want to be a less terrible person." – Harley Quinn

Harley Quinn Quotes

36. “I love the rain. It’s like angels are splooging all over us.”

37. "I’m not shopping at this store: I’m robbing this store. Paying is for dummies!" – Harley

38. “That’s so cute, you think you’re scary. Well, mister, I’ve seen scary and you don’t have his smile.”

45. “I know how to make some smiles, Puddin.”

-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.meta_description: Learn about a number of signs of intelligence that may be apparent in someone according to psychology.
-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.content:
10 Signs of Intelligent People According to Psychology

Learn about a number of signs of intelligence that may be apparent in someone according to psychology.

10 Signs of Intelligent People According to Psychology

Intelligence is a concept that goes beyond the traditional IQ assessment and encompasses various abilities that go beyond cognitive processes.

Intelligence includes the capacity for reasoning, memory, and problem-solving.

However, true intelligence goes beyond these limitations and involves emotional intelligence, creativity, and flexibility in facing everyday challenges.

Understanding individuals from various backgrounds is important in identifying intelligence because they may have different experiences with standard test formats, which can conceal their true intellectual abilities.

From a psychological perspective, someone can be considered intelligent when viewed from various angles.

According to Psychologs, here are some signs of intelligent people according to psychology.

Pleasant and Diligent Attitude

Smart people tend to have a positive attitude towards various aspects of their lives, whether it's personal, social, or professional.

They are open to learning, accepting feedback and criticism, and are very diligent when hard work is required.

In addition, they are always ready for self-improvement and tend to develop in various fields without expecting appreciation.

They approach all challenges in their lives with a positive attitude and see them as reasons for change and growth.

Making Accurate and Credible Decisions

Smart people are known for their decision-making skills based on strong intuition.

They are able to analyze results quickly and accurately, as well as consider various perspectives before making decisions.

This ability allows them to distinguish between the advantages and disadvantages of each decision they have to make.

Strong Self-Control

Self-control involves a high level of self-awareness.

Intelligent individuals are highly disciplined and able to regulate their emotions, impulses, and behaviors.

Self-control is a sign of maturity, and in intelligent individuals, this quality is very commonly seen.

They are not impulsive and remain calm in the face of discomfort, allowing themselves to solve problems with focus and rationality to quickly reduce discomfort.

This self-control makes them highly resilient to pressure.

High Emotional Intelligence

In addition to logical intelligence, smart people tend to have a better understanding of emotions and how to connect with others, showing love and empathy, and always knowing the right words to say because of their high emotional intelligence.

People like this are not only able to help others manage their emotions, but also able to identify and manage their own emotions.

Analytical Thinking

People with high IQs demonstrate analytical thinking and attention to detail.

They are able to think outside the box, making them creative, adaptive, and versatile.

According to psychologists Getzel and Jackson, intelligent individuals may or may not have creativity depending on their intelligence level, but generally, they exhibit analytical and critical thinking.

Curiosity and Openness towards New Experiences

Smart people engage in conversations that pique their interest and usually ask questions like who, what, when, where, how, and why.

They have a natural curiosity and thirst for knowledge.

They are enthusiastic about learning about various aspects of life, including people, cultures, animals, history, and the world.

Smart people realize that others have information and insights to share that will help them grow, expand their wisdom, and enhance their intelligence.

Very Adaptive

Adaptability is a unique quality and key component of intelligence.

It is the ability to adjust to new situations and changes.

Smart people can easily adapt to new situations, environments, and challenges, showing flexibility and resilience.

In facing different circumstances, they are also able to balance consistency and flexibility, knowing when to stick to their routines and when to embrace new opportunities.

Skeptical

In addition to being open-minded, intelligent people tend to question everything, evaluate information and ideas critically rather than accepting them at face value.

The ability to be skeptical allows them to understand all the knowledge they acquire and develop their perspectives by questioning and analyzing all information.

Good Observation Skills

Observation is one of the important skills of highly intelligent individuals to process large amounts of information, paying attention to even the smallest details.

Smart people are able to identify mistakes and inconsistencies that may be overlooked by others, making their contributions valuable to a team or project.

Open-Minded

Smart people never stop themselves from learning new ideas and engaging in new opportunities.

They are willing to accept and consider other people's views with value and open-mindedness, appreciating diverse ideas and promoting a broad understanding of the world.

Having an open mind makes smart people easily continue to grow because their perspectives are constantly changing.

There are several signs that are commonly seen and exhibited by intelligent people.

So, do you have any of these signs?

-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.meta_description: Mountains are some of nature's most impressive creations.

7 Most Beautiful Mountains In The World That Will Take Your Breath Away

For nature lovers and adventurers alike, these most beautiful mountains offer unforgettable experiences. They also present views that will stay with you long after seeing them. (Photo by Gianluca Grisenti on Pexels)

7 Most Beautiful Mountains In The World That Will Take Your Breath Away

Mountains are some of nature's most impressive creations.

They rise above the earth, reaching into the sky with snow-capped peaks and rugged slopes. For nature lovers, mountains present breathtaking views, various ecosystems, and unforgettable experiences. Here are seven of the world's most beautiful mountains that are sure to amaze anyone who sees them:

1. Mount Fuji, Japan: This iconic mountain is known for its nearly perfect cone shape.

It stands alone, rising gracefully from the surrounding plains. Mount Fuji symbolizes Japan and is a sacred site in Japanese culture. Its symmetrical form and snow-capped peaks make it a favorite subject for photographers and artists.

2. Matterhorn, Switzerland/Italy:

Located on the border between Switzerland and Italy, the Matterhorn is one of the most recognizable mountains in the world.

Its distinctive pyramid shape and steep faces have made it a symbol of the Alps and a challenge for climbers.

3. Table Mountain, South Africa:

This flat-topped mountain overlooks Cape Town and the Atlantic Ocean. Its unique shape and diverse plant life make it a natural wonder.

Visitors can take a cable car to the top for panoramic city views and coastline views.

4. Denali, United States: Once known as Mount McKinley, Denali is the highest peak in North America.

Located in Alaska, it's surrounded by vast wilderness and diverse wildlife. Its massive size and snow-covered slopes create an awe-inspiring sight.

5. Mount Kilimanjaro, Tanzania: As Africa's highest mountain, Kilimanjaro is famous for its snow-capped peak near the equator. It rises dramatically from the surrounding savanna, creating a striking contrast. The mountain is home to various ecosystems that change with altitude.

6. Tre Cime di Lavaredo, Italy:

These three distinctive peaks in the Italian Dolomites are known for their unique shapes and changing colors.

The rocks glow with warm hues at sunrise and sunset, creating a magical atmosphere.

7. Vinicunca, Peru: Also known as Rainbow Mountain, Vinicunca is famous for its colorful stripes. Mineral deposits have created red, yellow, green, and blue bands across its slopes. These features result in a natural wonder that looks almost unreal.

These most beautiful mountains represent the most beautiful natural wonders our world offers.

Each is unique, with its shape, colors, and surrounding landscapes. Whether you're an experienced hiker or enjoy admiring nature from afar, these mountains will take your breath away. They remind us of our planet's incredible diversity and beauty, inspiring awe and respect for the natural world.

For nature lovers and adventurers alike, these most beautiful mountains offer unforgettable experiences. They also present views that will stay with you long after seeing them.

37 Giving Up Quotes to Keep Pushing Forward

37 Giving Up Quotes to Keep Pushing Forward

Would you be willing to share some words of encouragement? Giving up quotes might be just what you need. In times when life feels difficult, and challenges seem too big to conquer, these quotes may provide valuable insight.

Giving up quotes offers reminders that perseverance and determination can lead to success, even when things get tough. Whether facing difficulties in your studies, career, relationships, or personal goals, giving up quotes can be a powerful reminder to keep going.

So, let's dive into many quotes about giving up and finding the motivation to keep moving forward.

1. “Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.” – Thomas Edison

2. “Successful men and women keep moving. They make mistakes, but they don’t quit.” – Conrad Hilton

3. “Anyone can give up, it’s the easiest thing in the world to do. But to hold it together when everyone else would understand if you fell apart, that’s true strength.”

4. “There is no failure except in no longer trying.” – Elbert Hubbard

5. “The longer you hang in there, the greater the chance that something will happen in your favor.” – Jack Canfield

6. “When you are going through hell, keep on going. Never, never, never give up.” – Winston Churchill

7. “It’s not that I’m so smart, it’s just that I stay with problems longer.” – Albert Einstein

8. “No matter how hard the battle gets or no matter how many people don’t believe in your dream, never give up!” – Eric Thomas

9. “He conquers who endures.” – Persius

10. “Ambition is the path to success. Persistence is the vehicle you arrive in.” – Bill Bradley

10. “I am not discouraged because every wrong attempt discarded is a step forward” – Thomas Edison

12. “The difference between a successful person and others is not a lack of strength, not a lack of knowledge, but rather a lack of will.” – Vince Lombardi

13. “We will either find a way or make one.” – Hanibal

14. “Survival can be summed up in three words – Never give up. That’s the heart of it really. Just keep trying.” – Bear Grylls

15. “Strength does not come from winning. Your struggles develop your strengths. When you go through hardships and decide not to surrender, that is true strength.” – Arnold Schwarzenegger

16. “Our greatest glory is not in never falling but in rising every time we fall.” – Confucius

17. “It’s not whether you get knocked down. It’s whether you get back up.” – Vince Lombardi

18. “You just never give up. You do a task to the best of your abilities and beyond.” – Debbie Reynolds

19. “Don’t let the fear of the time it will take to accomplish something stand in the way of your doing it. The time will pass anyway; we might just as well put that passing time to the best possible use.” – Earl Nightingale

“It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.” – Confucius

21. Never give up. Today is hard, tomorrow will be worse, but the day after tomorrow will be sunshine.” – Jack Ma

22. “One day, you will thank yourself for never giving up. So press on!”

23. “Never give up on the fight until you win the belt.” – Israel Ayivor

24. “Fall seven times, stand up eight.” – Japanese Proverb

25. “If you believe it will work out, you’ll see opportunities. If you believe it won’t, you will see obstacles.” – Wayne Dyer

26. “If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.” – H.G. Wells

27. “Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.” – Albert Einstein

28. “You’re a fighter. Look at everything you’ve overcome. Don’t give up now.” – Olivia Benson

29. “Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.” – Dale Carnegie

30. “Every mountain top is within reach if you just keep climbing.” – Barry Finlay

“97% of the people who quit to soon are employed by the 3% that never gave up.” – Anonymous

32. “Remember that guy that gave up? Neither does no one else.”

33. “Don’t stop when you’re tired. Stop when you are done.”

34. “Success is what happens after you have survived all your mistakes.” – Anora Lee

35. “The difference between winning and losing is most often not quitting.” – Walt Disney

36. “Perseverance is the hard work you do after you get tired of doing the hard work you already did.” – Newt Gingrich

37. “It’s hard to beat a person who never gives up.” – Babe Ruth
















Author: Larasati Natasha (Intern)

The 7 Best Places to Visit in Bruges: Exploring the Beauty of the Venice of the North

The 7 Best Places to Visit in Bruges: Exploring the Beauty of the Venice of the North

Bruges, often referred to as the Venice of the North, is a beautiful city in Belgium that is definitely worth a visit.

With its charming canals, historic buildings, and delicious chocolate, Bruges has something to offer for everyone. Whether you are a history lover, an art enthusiast, or simply looking for a romantic getaway, Bruges has it all.

In this article, we will explore the best places to visit in Bruges and discover the beauty of this enchanting city.

1. Market Square 

Located in the heart of Bruges, Market Square, also known as Grote Markt, is a vibrant hub of activity. The square is surrounded by beautiful buildings, including the famous Belfry of Bruges.

Visitors can explore the various shops, cafes, and restaurants that line the square or simply relax and watch the world go by.

The Belfry of Bruges is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and an iconic landmark in the city.

2. Belfry of Bruges

Climb to the top of the tower for panoramic views of Bruges and the surrounding areas. The bells of the Belfry chime regularly, adding to the enchanting atmosphere of the city.

The Church of Our Lady is a stunning Gothic church with a towering spire that can be seen from across the city.

3. Church of Our Lady

Inside, you'll find beautiful art pieces, including Michelangelo's Madonna and Child sculpture. Take some time to admire the architecture and peaceful atmosphere of this historic church.

4. Basilica of the Holy Blood

The Basilica of the Holy Blood is another iconic religious site in Bruges. It is home to an important relic, a vial believed to contain a few drops of Jesus Christ's blood.

The basilica is a place of pilgrimage for many believers and a fascinating stop for visitors interested in religious history

5. Groeninge Museum

Art enthusiasts will enjoy a visit to the Groeninge Museum, which houses an impressive collection of Flemish art dating from the 15th to the 21st century.

Admire works by renowned artists such as Jan van Eyck, Hans Memling, and Hieronymus Bosch as you explore the museum's galleries.

6. Minnewaterpark

For a relaxing escape from the city's hustle and bustle, head to Minnewaterpark, also known as the Lake of Love.

This tranquil park features a picturesque lake, swans gliding on the water, and plenty of green spaces for picnicking or leisurely walks.

It's the perfect spot to unwind and enjoy nature in the heart of Bruges.

7. Quay of the Rosary

The Quay of the Rosary is a charming waterfront area lined with historic buildings and cozy cafes. This place is one of the most iconic spots in the city.

Take a stroll along the canal, watch the boats pass by, and snap photos of the picturesque scenery. This area is particularly magical at sunset when the golden light reflects off the water.

Deadpool Quotes: The Most Hilarious and Iconic Lines
