10 Dog Breeds That Act Like Cats Personalities You Will Adore

Dogs are known for their loyal and playful nature. Do you know that some dog breeds can exhibit cat-like personalities? If you're a fan of dogs and cats, you might want to consider getting a furry friend from one of these 10 breeds.

From being independent and aloof to having a strong prey drive, these dogs will amuse your heart with their unique behaviors. Let's look at 10 dog breeds that act like cat personalities you will adore.

1. Basenji

Known as the "barkless dog," Basenjis are independent, clean animals who groom themselves like cats.

2. Chow Chow

This fluffy breed may have a cat-like aloofness, but they are fiercely loyal to their family members.

3. Shiba Inu

Shiba Inus are known for their independent nature and love of cleanliness, much like a feline friend.

4. Afghan Hound

With their elegant appearance and independent personality, Afghan Hounds can be quite aloof, like a cat.

5. Whippet

These sleek dogs have a strong prey drive, similar to that of a cat chasing after a bird or mouse.

6. Manchester Terrier

Manchester Terriers are known for their agility and hunting instincts, much like a cat stalking its prey.

7. Xoloitzcuintli

Also known as the Mexican Hairless Dog, Xolos are aloof and independent, much like a cat who likes to do things on their own terms.

8. Maltese

Despite their small size, Maltese dogs have a confident and independent personality, much like a cat who knows what they want.

9. Vizsla

Known for their high energy levels and agility, Vizslas are always on the move, just like a playful feline friend.

10. Greyhound

Despite their reputation as racing dogs, Greyhounds are known to be gentle and calm companions, much like a laid-back cat lounging in the sun.

If you're looking for a dog with a bit of a cat-like twist, consider one of these 10 breeds.

These dogs will bring something unique and special to your life and family. These fantastic breeds allow you to have the best of both worlds when it comes to deciding whether you want a dog or a cat.

Italian Question Words: Essential Guide for Beginners

Learning to ask questions is very important when studying a new language. In Italian, there are several key question words that can help you get information and have conversations. This guide will teach you the most common Italian question words, how to use them, and give lots of examples. By learning these words, you’ll be able to ask all kinds of questions in Italian.

The Main Italian Question Words

Here are the most important Italian question words to know:

• Che / Cosa / Che cosa – What

• Chi – Who

• Dove – Where

• Quando – When

• Perché – Why

• Come – How

• Quale – Which

• Quanto – How much/many

Let’s look at each of these in more detail with examples of how to use them.

Che / Cosa / Che cosa (What)

These three words all mean “what” in Italian. They can often be used interchangeably:

• Che cosa fai? – What are you doing?

• Cosa vuoi mangiare? – What do you want to eat?

• Che libro stai leggendo? – What book are you reading?

“Che” is a bit more informal, while “che cosa” is slightly more formal. “Cosa” is somewhere in between. You’ll hear all three used commonly.

Some other examples:

• Che ore sono? – What time is it?

• Che giorno è oggi? – What day is it today?

• Cosa c’è per cena? – What’s for dinner?

Chi (Who)

“Chi” is used to ask about people:

• Chi è quella donna? – Who is that woman?

• Chi ha preso il mio libro? – Who took my book?

• Con chi stai parlando? – Who are you talking to?

You can also use “di chi” to ask “whose”:

• Di chi è questa borsa? – Whose bag is this?

• Di chi sono questi occhiali? – Whose glasses are these?

Dove (Where)

“Dove” is used to ask about location:

• Dove abiti? – Where do you live?

• Dove andiamo stasera? – Where are we going tonight?

• Dov’è il bagno? – Where is the bathroom?

Notice that “dove” becomes “dov'” before words starting with a vowel, like “è”.

You can also use “da dove” to ask where someone is from:

• Da dove vieni? – Where are you from?

Quando (When)

“Quando” is used to ask about time:

• Quando parti? – When are you leaving?

• Quando inizia il film? – When does the movie start?

• Quando è il tuo compleanno? – When is your birthday?

Perché (Why)

“Perché” is used to ask for reasons:

• Perché studi l’italiano? – Why are you studying Italian?

• Perché non vieni alla festa? – Why aren’t you coming to the party?

• Perché sei triste? – Why are you sad?

Interestingly, “perché” can also mean “because” when used in an answer:

• Perché studi l’italiano? – Why are you studying Italian?

• Perché mi piace la cultura italiana. – Because I like Italian culture.

Come (How)

“Come” is used to ask how something is done or about someone’s state:

• Come stai? – How are you?

• Come ti chiami? – What’s your name? (literally “How are you called?”)

• Come si dice “hello” in italiano? – How do you say “hello” in Italian?

“Come” can also mean “like” or “as”:

• È rosso come una mela. – It’s red like an apple.

Quale (Which)

“Quale” is used to ask which one out of a group:

• Quale vestito preferisci? – Which dress do you prefer?

• Quale di questi libri hai letto? – Which of these books have you read?

“Quale” changes to “quali” for plural nouns:

• Quali ingredienti servono per la pizza? – Which ingredients are needed for pizza?

Before a word starting with a vowel, “quale” becomes “qual” (without an apostrophe):

• Qual è il tuo colore preferito? – What is your favorite color?

Quanto (How much/many)

“Quanto” is used to ask about quantity. It changes form to match the gender and number of what you’re asking about:

• Quanto costa questa maglietta? – How much does this t-shirt cost?

• Quanta farina serve per fare la pizza? – How much flour is needed to make pizza?

• Quanti anni hai? – How old are you? (literally “How many years do you have?”)

• Quante persone ci sono? – How many people are there?

Using Italian Question Words in Sentences

When forming questions in Italian, the question word usually goes at the beginning of the sentence. The word order is often similar to English:

• Dove abiti? – Where do you live?

• Quando arriva il treno? – When does the train arrive?

• Come ti chiami? – What’s your name?

Sometimes, especially in informal speech, the subject can come at the end:

• Viene alla festa Maria? – Is Maria coming to the party?

In Italian, you don’t need to use “do” or “does” to form questions like in English. The question mark and your tone of voice show that you’re asking a question.

Common Mistakes to Avoid

Here are some common mistakes to watch out for when using Italian question words:

• Don’t confuse “che” and “chi”. “Che” means “what”, while “chi” means “who”.

• Remember to use “quale” for “which” questions, not “che”.

• Don’t forget to change “quanto” to match the gender and number of what you’re asking about.

• Don’t put prepositions at the end of questions like in English. In Italian, they go before the question word:

o Con chi vai al cinema? – Who are you going to the movies with?

o Di che cosa parlate? – What are you talking about?

Practice Exercises

Here are some exercises to help you practice using Italian question words:

Exercise 1: Fill in the blank with the correct question word

1. _____ è il tuo nome? (What)

2. _____ vai in vacanza? (Where)

3. _____ anni ha tuo fratello? (How many)

4. _____ colore ti piace di più? (Which)

5. _____ studi l’italiano? (Why)

Exercise 2: Translate these questions into Italian

1. When does the store open?

2. Who is that man?

3. How do you say “goodbye” in Italian?

4. What time is it?

5. How much does this book cost?

Exercise 3: Create questions using these words

1. dove / andare / weekend (Where are you going this weekend?)

2. quando / arrivare / treno (When does the train arrive?)

3. chi / essere / ragazza (Who is that girl?)

4. perché / studiare / italiano (Why are you studying Italian?)

5. come / fare / pasta (How do you make pasta?)

Tips for Learning Italian Question Words

Here are some tips to help you learn and remember Italian question words:

• Practice using question words in context. Try to form questions about things you see or do every day.

• Listen to Italian conversations or watch Italian movies and TV shows. Pay attention to how native speakers use question words.

• Make flashcards with the question word on one side and an example sentence on the other.

• Try to have conversations in Italian, even if it’s just with yourself. Ask and answer questions about your day or your surroundings.

• Use language learning apps or online resources that have interactive exercises for practicing question words.

• Don’t be afraid to make mistakes. The more you practice, the more natural using these words will become.

Beyond Basic Questions: Advanced Uses

Once you’re comfortable with basic questions, you can start using question words in more complex ways:

Indirect Questions

Indirect questions are when you report a question within another sentence. For example:

• Non so dove sia il ristorante. – I don’t know where the restaurant is.

• Mi chiedo perché non sia venuto. – I wonder why he didn’t come.

Notice that in indirect questions, the verb often changes to the subjunctive mood (sia instead of è).

Rhetorical Questions

Question words can also be used to ask rhetorical questions, which don’t expect an answer:

• Chi lo sa? – Who knows?

• Cosa vuoi che faccia? – What do you want me to do?

Exclamations

Some question words can be used to form exclamations:

• Che bello! – How beautiful!

• Quanta gente! – So many people!

Regional Variations in Italian Question Words

While the question words we’ve covered are standard across Italy, you might hear some regional variations:

• In Rome and parts of southern Italy, people often shorten questions. For example, “Che fai?” instead of “Che cosa fai?” (What are you doing?)

• In Venice and parts of the Veneto region, you might hear “Cossa” instead of “Cosa”.

• In very informal speech, some regions might drop the question word altogether and just use intonation to indicate a question.

Using Question Words in Polite Conversation

When speaking formally or to strangers, it’s polite to add words like “scusi” (excuse me) or “per favore” (please) to your questions:

• Scusi, dov’è la stazione? – Excuse me, where is the station?

• Potrebbe dirmi che ore sono, per favore? – Could you tell me what time it is, please?

Question Words in Italian Idioms

Some Italian idioms use question words. Here are a few common ones:

• “Chi vivrà, vedrà” – Who lives, will see (similar to “Time will tell”)

• “Perché no?” – Why not?

• “Come mai?” – How come? (used similarly to “why”)

Conclusion

Learning Italian question words is a key step in being able to communicate effectively in Italian. These words allow you to ask for information, express curiosity, and engage in meaningful conversations. Remember, the best way to get comfortable with these words is through practice. Don’t be afraid to use them, even if you make mistakes at first. With time and practice, forming questions in Italian will become second nature. Keep studying, keep practicing, and soon you’ll be asking questions like a native Italian speaker!

Amex Platinum: The Updates We Know From The Card

American Express has announced a sweeping overhaul of its iconic Platinum Card, with the most significant updates in the card’s history set to roll out in late 2025.

The move is part of a broader strategy to attract affluent Millennials and Gen Z consumers, who now make up a substantial share of new premium cardholders in the U.S.

While American Express has not yet released the full details, executives describe this as the “largest investment ever in a Card refresh.”

The updates will impact both the personal and business versions of the Platinum Card, with a focus on enhancing travel, dining, and lifestyle benefits to meet evolving customer expectations.

The refresh comes amid intensifying competition in the premium credit card market, particularly as JPMorgan Chase prepares to update its rival Sapphire Reserve card.

American Express is responding to the spending habits of younger, digitally savvy consumers who prioritize experiences, personalization, and flexibility over traditional rewards.

Recent data shows Millennials and Gen Z now account for 75% of new Platinum and Gold card accounts, with spending from these groups surging 40% year-over-year.

The company’s strategy is to build lifelong loyalty by aligning benefits with the values and lifestyles of these new power spenders. 

The Platinum Card’s annual fee remains at $695 for now, but industry observers speculate it could rise with the new benefits package.

The rollout of the refreshed card experience will begin in phases later this year, with more details expected in fall 2025.

Today, American Express is announcing that major updates are coming to its U.S. Consumer and Business Platinum Cards®. With these updates, the company is making its largest investment ever in a Card refresh. Read more: https://t.co/Bnn68B7P3M pic.twitter.com/myVePzh90n

— American Express (@AmericanExpress) June 16, 2025

Several Important New Updates

  1. Expanded Lifestyle Perks: New luxury experiences such as wellness retreats, culinary events, and exclusive travel access are on the horizon. 
  2. Personalized Offers: AI-driven insights will deliver more tailored rewards and dynamic offers, reflecting individual cardholder behavior.
  3. Revamped Welcome Bonuses: New cardholders may see larger sign-up offers, especially in luxury spending categories.
  4. Premium Subscription Credits: Enhanced credits for digital platforms (e.g., Netflix, Spotify, fitness apps) are likely to be introduced. 
  5. Broader Airport Lounge Access: Three new Centurion Lounges are planned for Newark, Salt Lake City, and Tokyo, bringing the global total to 32.
  6. Dining Benefits Expansion: Following the acquisition of Tock, Amex will add 7,000 new dining options, including wineries, to its Resy platform, giving cardholders priority access at more restaurants.

-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.meta_description: Reading these powerful quotes by Epictetus will help you to learn the stoic way of life.
-- Batch 11\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_art.content:
40 Quotes by Epictetus About the Stoic Way of Life

Looking for wise words that can calm your mind and help you live better? Quotes by Epictetus are a great place to start. His words are short but full of meaning. Many people turn to his quotes when they feel lost or need peace in their daily life.

Epictetus was a Greek philosopher born around 55 AD in the city of Hierapolis, which is now in modern-day Turkey. He was born into slavery and brought to Rome, where he later gained his freedom. After that, he studied philosophy and began teaching others. He followed the Stoic way of thinking, which focuses on self-control, wisdom, and accepting things we cannot change. Quotes by Epictetus often teach people to focus on their actions and not worry about what they cannot control.

In this article, we will share some of the best quotes by Epictetus that will inspire your life. These quotes are great for daily reflection or when you need a little motivation. We gathered these quotes from various sources, Wednesday (2/7/2025). Take your time to read and think about their meaning.

Deep Quotes by Epictetus About Life

1. "Suffering arises from trying to control what is uncontrollable, or from neglecting what is within our power."

2. "He who is not happy with little will never be happy with much."

3. "No man is free who is not master of himself."

4. "There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will."

5. "People are not disturbed by things, but by the view they take of them."

6. “Man is not worried by real problems so much as by his imagined anxieties about real problems”

7. “He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.”

8. “Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.”

9. “Only the educated are free.”

10. “It is the nature of the wise to resist pleasures, but the foolish to be a slave to them.”

11. “Don't hope that events will turn out the way you want, welcome events in whichever way they happen: this is the path to peace.”

12. “Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.”

13. "You are a little soul carrying around a corpse."

14. "All religions must be tolerated... for every man must get to heaven in his own way."

15. "Is freedom anything else than the right to live as we wish? Nothing else."

16. "It is not death or pain that is to be dreaded, but the fear of pain or death."

17. "Freedom is not procured by a full enjoyment of what is desired, but by controlling the desire."

18. "If you seek truth you will not seek victory by dishonorable means, and if you find truth you will become invincible."

19. "It is the nature of the wise to resist pleasures, but the foolish to be a slave to them."

20. "We tell lies, yet it is easy to show that lying is immoral."

Inspirational Quotes by Epictetus

1. "It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters."

2. “Any person capable of angering you becomes your master; he can anger you only when you permit yourself to be disturbed by him.”

3. "It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows."

4. "We have two ears and one mouth so that we can listen twice as much as we speak."

5. "The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best."

5. "Know, first, who you are, and then adorn yourself accordingly."

6. "If evil be spoken of you and it be true, correct yourself, if it be a lie, laugh at it."

7. “First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.”

8. “If anyone tells you that a certain person speaks ill of you, do not make excuses about what is said of you but answer, 'He was ignorant of my other faults, else he would not have mentioned these alone.'”

9. “We should not moor a ship with one anchor, or our life with one hope.”

10. “Nothing truly stops you. Nothing truly holds you back. For your own will is always within your control.”

11. “First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.”

12. "Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens."

13. "Difficulties are things that show a person what they are."

14. "No great thing is created suddenly."

15. "No greater thing is created suddenly, any more than a bunch of grapes or a fig. If you tell me that you desire a fig, I answer you that there must be time. Let it first blossom, then bear fruit, then ripen."

16. “He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has.”

17. “To accuse others for one's own misfortune is a sign of want of education. To accuse oneself shows that one's education has begun. To accuse neither oneself nor others shows that one's education is complete.”

18. “Attach yourself to what is spiritually superior, regardless of what other people think or do. Hold to your true aspirations no matter what is going on around you.”

19. “Don't seek to have events happen as you wish, but wish them to happen as they do happen, and all will be well with you.”

20. “Seek not the good in external things;seek it in yourselves.”

Dua Lipa Shares Phone Number for Free on Social Media

Dua Lipa Shares Phone Number for Free on Social Media

Do you know if this is a marketing strategy for the new album?

Dua Lipa shared her cell phone number and invited fans to 'send a message to Dua Lipa' through the number she shared for free on social media.

A post with a photo of a contact in a cell phone that lists Dua Lipa's name and the number +1 (917) 810-3415 spread on social media.

Many fans saved the number and tried to contact the singer.

However, this number led Dua Lipa fans into a community conversation.

This is the latest signal from Dua Lipa, who is preparing to release her third studio album, which has yet to be officially announced.

In addition, Dua Lipa released her comeback song titled "Houdini" in November.

Tame Impala's Kevin Parker served as co-writer and producer on the song.

According to Dua Lipa, the song she created in her single days represents her, who is free to be open to anything.

"'Houdini' is very wordy, exploring the idea of whether someone is really worth it to me or whether I'll scare them away in the end. You never know where something will take you, that's the beauty of being open to whatever happens in your life. I can't wait to share that happy feeling with my fans."


The 'life' of the disco-friendly track is further evident in the music video, which features Dua Lipa practicing her dance moves with energy.

"Houdini" has entered the Prambors Top 40 as a new entry single.

It's a good idea to save Dua Lipa's phone number. The number may provide the most up-to-date information about Dua Lipa's new album, which will likely be released soon.

10 Most Gorgeous Italian Cars of All Time

10 Most Gorgeous Italian Cars of All Time

Italy is renowned for its beautiful architecture, delicious cuisine, and of course, its stunning cars.

Italian car manufacturers have produced some of the most gorgeous vehicles in the world, each with a rich history and unique design. Let's take a closer look at ten of the most gorgeous Italian cars of all time.

1. Alfa Romeo 33 Stradale

The Alfa Romeo 33 Stradale is a true masterpiece, with only 18 units ever produced. It was unveiled in 1967 as a road-legal version of the Tipo 33 racing car. The car is powered by a 2.0-liter V8 engine and has a top speed of 160 mph. Its sleek, aerodynamic design makes it a timeless classic.

2. Ferrari 250 GTO

The Ferrari 250 GTO is considered one of the most valuable and desired cars in the world. Produced in the early 1960s, this beauty was designed for racing and won numerous competitions.

With its powerful V12 engine and stunning curves, the 250 GTO is a symbol of Ferrari's racing pedigree.

3. Ferrari 250 Testarossa

Another iconic Ferrari, the 250 Testarossa, was introduced in the late 1950s. Its long, sleek body and distinctive side vents resemble a shark, giving it a fierce and elegant appearance. The Testarossa's performance on the track solidified its place in automotive history.

4. Lamborghini Miura

The Lamborghini Miura revolutionized the sports car industry when it was introduced in 1966. With its mid-engine layout and striking design, the Miura set the standard for supercars. Its powerful V12 engine and innovative features made it a favorite among enthusiasts.

5. Bizzarrini 5300 GT Strada

The Bizzarrini 5300 GT Strada is a rare and collectible Italian car, with only a handful ever built.

Designed by Giotto Bizzarrini in the 1960s, this beauty features a sleek, aerodynamic body and a powerful V8 engine.

Its unique design and performance capabilities make it a true gem for car enthusiasts.

6. Ferrari 330 P4

The Ferrari 330 P4 is a legendary racing car that dominated the competition in the late 1960s.

With its powerful engine and advanced aerodynamics, the P4 was a force to be reckoned with on the track.

Its iconic design and racing success have solidified its place in automotive history.

7. Alfa Romeo Disco Volante

The Alfa Romeo Disco Volante, or "Flying Saucer," is a rare and futuristic car that was introduced in the 1950s.

Its streamlined design and advanced engineering made it ahead of its time. The Disco Volante's unique shape and performance capabilities make it a true marvel of Italian automotive design.

8. Lamborghini Countach LP400

The Lamborghini Countach LP400 is an iconic supercar that was introduced in the 1970s. Its sharp angles, scissor doors, and powerful V12 engine made it a symbol of excess and luxury. The Countach's futuristic design still turns heads today.

9. Alfa Romeo 8C 2900B Mille Miglia Roadster

The Alfa Romeo 8C 2900B Mille Miglia Roadster is a rare and breathtaking car that was produced in the late 1930s.

Designed for the Mille Miglia race, this beauty features a streamlined body and a powerful inline-eight engine.

Its racing success and elegant design make it a true gem of Italian automotive history.

10. Alfa Romeo Giulietta SS

The Alfa Romeo Giulietta SS is a stylish and sporty car that was produced in the late 1950s. 

Its compact size, sleek design, and impressive performance made it a favorite among racing enthusiasts.

The Giulietta SS's classic Italian design and spirited driving experience make it a standout in automotive history.

Top 5 Scariest Japanese Horror Movies Of All Time

Top 5 Scariest Japanese Horror Movies Of All Time

The Japanese film industry is famous for creating some of the scariest horror movies. These films are well-known for their great picture quality and frightening stories that make people scream in fear.

In this article, we have selected some of the scariest Japanese horror movies of all time. These films are known for their spooky plots that will send shivers down your spine.

"Ringu," also known as "The Ring," is a renowned horror movie directed by Hideo Nakata and adapted from a novel by Koji Suzuki.

1. Ringu (1998)

"Ringu": Storyline

The film follows the eerie journey of a reporter and her ex-husband as they investigate the mystery surrounding a cursed videotape. Anyone who watches this sinister tape is believed to die within seven days.

"Ringu" is widely regarded as one of the finest and most influential Japanese horror movies of all time, celebrated for its gripping storyline and the iconic image of Sadako Yamamura, the vengeful ghost featured in the videotape.

"Dark Water" is another outstanding Japanese horror film directed by the renowned Hideo Nakata.

2. Dark Water (2002)

"Dark Water": Storyline

The movie revolves around the life of Yoshimi Matsubara, who, after a divorce, moves to a new apartment with her daughter. However, she soon discovers that their new apartment is haunted by the spirit of a girl who threatens their lives.

Beyond the terror of the vengeful ghost, "Dark Water" skillfully portrays the deep love of a mother and her fear of losing her daughter.

"Jigoku," also known as "The Sinners of Hell," is a classic Japanese horror movie released in 1960.

3. Jigoku (1960)

"Jigoku": Storyline

The film tells the story of a young student named Shiro who, after a hit-and-run accident, finds himself trapped in a cycle of sin and guilt. As the story unfolds, Shiro faces the consequences of his actions in the afterlife, descending into a nightmarish realm of punishment and judgment. "Jigoku" is famous for its clear and graphic portrayal of hell and serves as a cautionary tale. It highlights the moral consequences of one's choices.

"Ju-on: The Grudge" is the third film of the Ju-on series. It was released in 2002, written and directed by Takashi Shimizu.

4. Ju-on: The Grudge (2002)

"Ju-on: The Grudge": Storyline

It centers on a haunted house in Tokyo, where a gruesome murder took place. Those who step inside this cursed place find themselves haunted by vengeful spirits, leading to a series of terrifying and fatal events.

The movie is famous for its eerie ambiance, chilling encounters with these vengeful spirits, and complex narrative that tells a haunting and unsettling story.

Kwaidan" is a Japanese anthology horror film by Masaki Kobayashi. 

5. Kwaidan (1964)

"Kwaidan": Storyline

"Kwaidan" is based on "Kwaidan: Stories and Studies of Strange Things," a book by Lafcadio Hearn. It features four stories based on traditional Japanese folktales, each of which is more disturbing than the last.

"Kwaidan" is a haunting and unforgettable film that is sure to stay with viewers long after they have seen it.

Earlier this year, Queenzy was diagnosed with a rare form of cancer.

Her death marks a great sadness for the Malaysian entertainment industry. She is a key member of the famous group M-Girls and a respected actress and singer.

Queenzy Cheng was born on February 26, 1986, in Perlis, Malaysia.

She began her music career at five and became a beloved artist in Malaysian entertainment.

Diagnosed in March 2023, Queenzy has symptoms such as fatigue, weight loss, and stomach ache. She also underwent chemotherapy treatment and surgery.

But the cancer has spread. In October 2023, she decided to stop treatment. She spent her final days at home with her family.

Twilight Quotes: 35 Unforgettable Lines from the Movie Series

Have you ever been delighted by the world of vampires and werewolves? If so, you might be familiar with the famous Twilight movie series. The movies are filled with memorable lines that we call Twilight quotes. Twilight quotes show the emotions and struggles faced by the characters on their journey of love, friendship, and family.

The story is about Bella Swan, who falls in love with Edward Cullen, a vampire. They face numerous challenges as they navigate the complexities of human-vampire relationships. Let’s check out some of the most unforgettable Twilight quotes from the movies! instagram.com/twilight/

Twilight Quotes about Love

  • “You are the only one who has ever touched my heart. It will always be yours” – Edward Cullen

  • “You don’t know how long I’ve waited for you.” – Edward Cullen

  • “You wouldn’t have to change for me, Bella. I’m in love with you, and I want you to pick me instead of him.” – Jacob Black

  • “I thought I’d explained it clearly before. Bella, I can’t live in a world where you don’t exist.” – Edward Cullen

  • “No measure of time with you will be long enough, but we’ll start with forever.” – Edward Cullen

  • “Until your heart stops beating, Bella. I’ll be here – fighting. Don’t forget that you have options.” – Jacob Black

  • “Look after my heart. I’ve left it with you.” – Edward Cullen

  • “My life was an unending, unchanging, midnight. How was it possible that the sun was rising now, in the middle of my midnight?” – Edward Cullen

  • “I’d never given much thought to how I would die. But dying in place of someone I love, seems like a good way to go. I can’t bring myself to regret the decisions that brought me face-to-face with death. They also brought me to Edward.” – Bella Swan

“Imprinting on someone is like… Like when you see her… Everything changes. All of a sudden, it’s not gravity holding you to the planet. It’s her… Nothing else matters. You would do anything… be anything for her.” – Jacob Black

  • “I don’t have the strength to stay away from you anymore.” – Edward Cullen

  • “About three things, I was absolutely positive. First, Edward was a vampire. Second, there was a part of him—and I didn’t know how dominant that part might be—that thirsted for my blood. And third, I was unconditionally and irrevocably in love with him.” – Bella Swan

  • “It’s possible to love more than one person at a time.” – Jacob Black

  • “I was in love with the idea of love.” – Rosalie

“Stop trying to take your clothes off. It might be too late for my soul, but I will protect yours.” – Edward Cullen

Funny Twilight Quotes

  • “You know your mood swings are kinda giving me whiplash.” – Bella Swan

  • “Yeah, um... I had an adrenaline rush. It's very common. You can Google it.” – Edward Cullen

  • “I leave you alone for five minutes and the wolves descend.” -Edward Cullen

  • “Don’t worry about the bears, Bella. My kung fu is strong.” – Harry Clearwater

  • “Dude, you really don’t want to start comparing stinks.” – Jacob Black

  • “You better hold on tight, spider monkey.” – Edward Cullen

  • “I like watching you sleep. It’s, uh, kinda fascinating to me.” – Bella Swan

  • “Look, I’m sorry I’m being rude all the time. I just think it’s the best way.” – Edward Cullen

  • “What did you expect? Coffins and dungeons and moats?” – Edward Cullen

  • “Dude, you really don’t want to start comparing stinks.” – Bella Swan
  • “Hi, I’m Jacob. We used to make mud pies when we were little.” – Jacob Black

  • “What did you expect? Coffins and dungeons and moats?” – Edward Cullen

  • “So you’re worried, not because you’ll be in a house full of vampires, but because you think they won’t approve you?” – Edward Cullen

  • “He called you pretty… That’s practically an insult, the way you look right now… You’re much more than beautiful.” – Edward Cullen

  • “I’m really kind of the more suffer-in-silence type.” – Bella Swan

  • “Get a whiff of that, here comes the human!” – Rosalie Hale


  • “I like watching you sleep. It’s, uh, kinda fascinating to me.” – Edward Cullen

  • “It’s like first grade all over again. You’re the shiny new toy.” – Jessica Stanley

  • “Aren’t people from Arizona supposed to be like, really tan?” – Jessica Stanley

  • “The little dark-haired girl’s Alice. She’s really weird, and she’s with Jasper, the blond who looks like he’s in pain.” – Jessica Stanley

Sample LSAT Questions: A Comprehensive Guide

Introduction to LSAT Sample Questions

The Law School Admission Test (LSAT) is an important exam for people who want to go to law school. It tests skills that are needed for success in law school. The LSAT has different types of questions that check how well you can think critically, analyze arguments, and understand complex texts.

Sample LSAT questions help you get ready for the real test. They show you what kinds of questions to expect and let you practice your skills. In this guide, we’ll look at sample questions from all parts of the LSAT. We’ll also give tips on how to answer them.

The LSAT has these main parts:

• Logical Reasoning

• Reading Comprehension

• Analytical Reasoning (also called “Logic Games”)

• Writing Sample

Let’s explore each type of question and see how to approach them.

Logical Reasoning Sample Questions

Logical Reasoning questions test how well you can analyze and evaluate arguments. These questions make up a big part of your LSAT score. Here are some sample questions to help you practice:

Sample Question 1:

Laird: Pure research gives us new technologies that help save lives. But even more important is how it expands our knowledge and gives us new ideas to explore.

Kim: Your priorities are wrong. Saving lives is the most important thing. Without pure research, medicine wouldn’t be as advanced as it is now.

Laird and Kim disagree about whether pure research:

1. Is important partly because it provides new technologies

2. Expands our knowledge of medicine

3. Should have saving human lives as an important goal

4. Has its most valuable achievements in medical applications

5. Has any value apart from providing new technologies to save lives

The correct answer is (D). Laird thinks expanding knowledge is more important than saving lives through new technologies. Kim thinks saving lives is most important. So they disagree about whether medical applications are the most valuable achievement of pure research.

Sample Question 2:

Executive: We recently ran ads in a travel magazine’s print version and on its website. We couldn’t get direct information about how people responded to the print ads. But we found that fewer people responded to the website ads than usual. We concluded that response to the print ads was probably below average too.

The executive’s reasoning does which of the following?

1. Predicts how strong something will be based on information about what caused it

2. Uses information about how often things usually happen to guess about a specific event

3. Makes a general rule based on many specific examples

4. Uses a case where direct evidence is available to draw a conclusion about a similar case where direct evidence isn’t available

5. Predicts future events based on recent similar events

The correct answer is (D). The executive uses information about the website ads (where they have data) to make a guess about the print ads (where they don’t have data). This is an example of using available evidence to draw conclusions about a similar situation without direct evidence.

Tips for Logical Reasoning Questions:

• Read the question carefully before looking at the answer choices.

• Identify the main conclusion and supporting evidence in the argument.

• Look for flaws or assumptions in the reasoning.

• Eliminate answer choices that are clearly wrong.

• Choose the answer that most accurately addresses the specific question asked.

Reading Comprehension Sample Questions

Reading Comprehension questions test your ability to understand and analyze complex texts. You’ll need to read passages and answer questions about them. Here’s a sample passage and questions:

Sample Passage:

During the construction of the Quebec Bridge in 1907, the bridge’s designer, Theodore Cooper, heard that the suspended span being built out from the bridge’s cantilever was bending downward by a fraction of an inch (2.54 centimeters). Before he could send a message to stop the project, the whole cantilever arm broke off and fell, along with seventy-five workers, into the St. Lawrence River. It was the worst bridge construction disaster in history. As a direct result of the investigation that followed, the engineering rules of thumb by which thousands of bridges had been built around the world were abandoned. Twentieth-century bridge engineers would from then on rely on much more rigorous applications of mathematical analysis.

Sample Question:

Which one of the following statements can be correctly inferred from the passage?

1. Bridges built before about 1907 were built without thorough mathematical analysis and were therefore unsafe for the public to use.

2. Cooper’s absence from the Quebec Bridge construction site resulted in the breaking off of the cantilever.

3. Nineteenth-century bridge engineers relied on their rules of thumb because analytical methods were not good enough to solve their design problems.

4. Only a more rigorous application of mathematical analysis to the design of the Quebec Bridge could have prevented its collapse.

5. Before 1907 the mathematical analysis used in engineering rules of thumb was not enough to completely ensure the safety of bridges under construction.

The correct answer is (E). The passage suggests that after the Quebec Bridge disaster, engineers stopped using the old rules of thumb and started using more rigorous mathematical analysis. This implies that the old methods were not sufficient to ensure bridge safety during construction.

Tips for Reading Comprehension Questions:

• Read the passage carefully, focusing on the main ideas and structure.

• Look for the author’s purpose and tone.

• Pay attention to transitions and relationships between ideas.

• Refer back to the passage when answering questions.

• Be careful not to choose answers based on outside knowledge – stick to what’s in the passage.

Analytical Reasoning Sample Questions

Analytical Reasoning questions, also known as “Logic Games,” test your ability to understand a structure of relationships and draw conclusions about that structure. Here’s a sample question:

Sample Question:

A company is selecting a project team of three people from a group of seven workers: Quinn, Ruiz, Smith, Taylor, Verma, Wells, and Xue. The selection must meet the following conditions:

• If Quinn is selected, Ruiz must also be selected.

• If Ruiz is selected, Smith cannot be selected.

• Either Taylor or Verma must be selected, but not both.

• Either Wells or Xue must be selected, but not both.

If Taylor is selected to be on the team, which one of the following must be true?

1. Quinn is selected.

2. Ruiz is selected.

3. Smith is selected.

4. Wells is selected.

5. Xue is selected.

The correct answer is (C). If Taylor is selected, Verma cannot be (condition 3). This means we need two more people. Wells and Xue can’t both be selected (condition 4), so we need one more person who isn’t Wells or Xue. It can’t be Quinn, because that would require Ruiz (condition 1), which would then exclude Smith (condition 2). So the only possibility is that Smith must be selected.

Tips for Analytical Reasoning Questions:

• Read the rules carefully and make a diagram or chart to represent the relationships.

• Look for connections between rules that create additional restrictions.

• Practice different types of diagrams to find what works best for you.

• Work through the questions systematically, eliminating impossible options.

• If you get stuck, move on and come back later – time management is crucial.

LSAT Writing Sample

The LSAT Writing Sample is an unscored part of the test, but law schools will see it as part of your application. You’ll be given a problem and asked to choose between two positions or courses of action. You need to argue for your choice.

Sample Prompt:

A small town is deciding how to use a piece of land that was recently donated to the community. There are two proposals:

Proposal A: Build a new community center with meeting rooms, a gym, and spaces for classes and events.

Proposal B: Create a nature preserve with walking trails, picnic areas, and educational displays about local plants and animals.

Write an essay arguing for one of these proposals. Consider factors like community needs, environmental impact, long-term benefits, and potential drawbacks of each option.

Tips for the Writing Sample:

• Choose a position and stick to it – don’t try to argue both sides.

• Organize your essay with a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion.

• Use specific examples and reasoning to support your argument.

• Address potential counterarguments to strengthen your position.

• Pay attention to grammar, spelling, and clarity of expression.

• Practice timed writing to improve your speed and efficiency.

General LSAT Test-Taking Strategies

To do well on the LSAT, you need more than just knowledge of the question types. Here are some general strategies to help you succeed:

• Manage your time carefully. Each section is 35 minutes long, so practice pacing yourself.

• Answer every question – there’s no penalty for wrong answers.

• If a question seems too hard, skip it and come back later if you have time.

• Use the process of elimination to narrow down your choices.

• Read all answer choices before selecting one.

• Don’t let difficult questions shake your confidence – stay focused.

• Practice under test-like conditions to build stamina and reduce stress on test day.

How to Practice with Sample Questions

Using sample LSAT questions effectively can greatly improve your performance. Here’s how to make the most of your practice:

• Start with untimed practice to focus on understanding the questions and developing your skills.

• As you improve, start timing yourself to match test conditions.

• Review all your answers, even the ones you got right. Understand why the correct answer is right and why the others are wrong.

• Keep a log of question types you find difficult and focus extra practice on those areas.

• Use official LSAT prep materials when possible, as these most closely match the real test.

• Take full-length practice tests regularly to build endurance and identify areas for improvement.

• Join a study group or work with a tutor to get different perspectives on challenging questions.

Additional LSAT Study Resources

While sample questions are crucial for LSAT prep, there are many other resources available to help you prepare:

• Official LSAT prep books from the Law School Admission Council (LSAC)

• Online LSAT prep courses

• LSAT prep apps for mobile practice

• Free LSAT practice tests available online

• LSAT prep classes at local colleges or test prep centers

• One-on-one tutoring with LSAT experts

• LSAT forums and discussion groups for peer support and advice

Remember to choose resources that fit your learning style and schedule. A mix of different study methods often works best.

Recent and Upcoming LSAT Changes

The LSAT has undergone some changes recently, and more are coming. It’s important to stay informed about these changes as you prepare:

• The LSAT is now primarily given in a digital format on a tablet.

• Starting in August 2023, most test-takers can choose between taking the test in person or remotely.

• Beginning with the August 2024 LSAT, the test will no longer include an Analytical Reasoning (Logic Games) section.

• The new format will have two scored Logical Reasoning sections and one scored Reading Comprehension section, plus one unscored experimental section.

• LSAT Writing will be replaced by LSAT Argumentative Writing in July 2024, with an extended time of 50 minutes.

Make sure to check the official LSAC website for the most up-to-date information on LSAT changes and how they might affect your test preparation.

Conclusion

Preparing for the LSAT with sample questions is a smart way to improve your skills and boost your confidence. By practicing different types of questions and using effective study strategies, you can increase your chances of getting a high score.

Remember that success on the LSAT comes from consistent practice and a good understanding of the test format. Use the sample questions and tips in this guide as a starting point, but don’t stop there. Keep practicing, stay motivated, and approach your LSAT preparation with dedication and a positive attitude.

Good luck with your LSAT preparation and your journey to law school!

The 10 Most Popular Dog Breeds of 2023 That Are Safe for Kids' Pets

Dogs have long been cherished as loyal companions and beloved family members. Choosing a breed is essential when finding your children's best furry friend. It is not only popular but also known for its harmony with kids. This article explores the 10 most popular dog breeds of 2023.

The 10 Most Popular Dog Breeds of 2023 That Are Safe for Kids' Pets

These breeds are considered safe and suitable for families with children. It ranges from playful and friendly personalities to gentle and patient characters. These breeds offer the ideal combination of brotherhood and child-friendly traits. So, let's look into the world of popular dog breeds. Discover the perfect addition to your family.
Photo: pixabay/Victoria_Regen

At the top of the popularity charts is the Labrador Retriever. It is known for its friendly and outgoing nature. Labs are incredibly versatile, making them excellent guides for kids of all ages. Labs are easy to train and typically get along well with other pets. Their gentle behavior and high intelligence make them the perfect companions.

1. Labrador Retriever

The Golden Retriever holds a special place in the hearts of families worldwide. They are known for their warm and affectionate nature. Goldens are patient, tolerant, and adore being around children. Their playful nature and innate desire to please. These make them ideal for families seeking a loyal and gentle partner.

2. Golden Retriever

A beagle is a small to medium-sized dog with a cheerful and sociable nature. Their athletic build and easy-going nature make them a popular choice for families. Beagles are known for their adaptability. They are able to succeed in urban and rural environments. They are patient with children and enjoy being part of a lively family setting.

3. Beagle

Despite their intimidating appearance, Bulldogs are actually gentle and kind-hearted dogs. A free and easy temperament is characteristic of them. They also have a natural relationship with children. These make them a popular choice for families. Bulldogs are loyal and protective. Their easygoing nature allows them to adapt well to various living situations.

4. Bulldog

Boxers are energetic and playful dogs. They have a wonderful combination of strength and gentleness. They have a natural relationship with children. They also love being part of an active family. Boxers are known for their protective instincts and make excellent watchdogs. They will ensure the safety of your kids while providing endless entertainment.

5. Boxer

Cavalier King Charles Spaniels are beloved for their caring and gentle nature. They are good in children's friends and make excellent playmates. These small yet strong dogs are known for their adaptability. Plus, their ability to bond closely with their human family members. It provides years of joy and companionship.

6. Cavalier King Charles Spaniel

Poodles come in three sizes (standard, miniature, and toy). They are highly intelligent and trainable. Poodles have a friendly and outgoing personality. They are great for children. Poodles are also known for their hypoallergenic coats. It can benefit families with allergies.

7. Poodle

Bichon Frises are small, fluffy dogs with delightful personality. They are known for their caring and friendly nature. These make them excellent buddies for kids. Bichons are social and adaptable. They can succeed in a loving family environment.

8. Bichon Frise

Vizslas are active and athletic dogs with a loving and gentle temperament. They are known for their patience and get along with children. Vizslas need plenty of exercise and mental stimulation. These make them an ideal match for families who enjoy an active lifestyle.

9. Vizsla

Cavachons are hybrid breeds. It crosses between a Cavalier King Charles Spaniel and a Bichon Frise. They inherit the best traits from both breeds. This includes their friendly nature, which includes being sociable, loving, and child-friendly. Cavachons are known for their playful personalities and adaptability. These make them a popular choice for families.

10. Cavalier Bichon (Cavachon)

Choosing the right dog breed for your family is a vital decision. Especially when considering safety and harmony with children. These 10 most popular dog breeds of 2023 offer a wonderful blend of popularity, temperament, and child-friendly characteristics. These breeds have become cherished buddies for families worldwide. When selecting the ideal furry friend, remember to evaluate your family's lifestyle, energy levels, and preferences. Any popular dog breed can bring joy with good care, training, and love. They will make you laugh. Also, have endless memories in your home as a safe and beloved pet for your kids.

30 Long Distance Relationship Quotes to Make Them Smile

30 Long Distance Relationship Quotes to Make Them Smile

Long distance relationships aren’t easy, and they often feel isolating.

People may find that reading long distance relationship quotes has the ability to pull them out of their loneliness. Reading these quotes can make you feel like your experience is shared and your feelings are understood.

Here are 30 long distance relationship quotes to send to your partner:

Short Long Distance Relationship Quotes

  • Distance gives us a reason to love harder.

  • I like the way you make me feel, even when you’re nowhere near.

  • You make me smile despite the miles

  • Not seeing you every day is hard, but not having you in my life would be worse.

  • You may be out of my sight, but you’re all I see.

  • Distance means so little when someone means so much.

  • The pain of parting is nothing to the joy of meeting again.

  • Though we may be miles apart, we’re always under the same sky.

  • Been dreaming of the day when we’re not miles apart.

  • Let’s just skip to the part where we get to spend the rest of our lives together.

Funny Long Distance Relationship Quotes

  • They think I’m crazy because I have been reading about teleporting so I can be right next to you.

  • I miss you like an idiot misses the point.

  • They say long distance relationships will teach you to communicate well… We should be mind-readers by now.

  • Yes, I believe in long distance relationships. There are seven billion people in the world, you really think your soulmate lives down the street?

  • If you think missing me is hard, you should try missing you.

  • I wish you could see the stupid smiles I get when we’re texting.

  • I was a night owl. Now I get up at 5 am just to call before you go to bed.

  • That, “You hang up first,” “No, you hang up first,” crap is really only funny the first two or three hundred times.

  • I never know “Good nights” and “Good mornings” could give me heart-attacks.

  • I don’t want to spend the rest of my life texting, emailing snap-chatting and messaging you on Facebook. I want to hold you and hear you whisper my name in the same space and the same time zone.

Heartwarming Long Distance Relationship Quotes

  • Love knows no boundaries and no distance; miles and obstacles mean absolutely nothing in the face of love.

  • Being in a long-distance relationship is like being in school all over again: Distance teaches us to appreciate the days that we get to spend together and how to define patience. It reminds us that every moment together is special, and every second together should be cherished… and just like when I was in school, I’d rather skip class and kiss you in the stairwell.

  • I don’t cry because we’ve been separated by distance, and for a matter of years. Why? Because for as long as we share the same sky and breathe the same air, we’re still together.

  • This long-distance thing is taking its toll on me. But then a simple call, text message from you, and your encouraging words give me strength again.

  • When I couldn’t see you or feel the warmth of your skin, I get paranoid. Sometimes I wonder if you would think of me the way I think of you.

  • I believe in the immeasurable power of love; that true love can endure any circumstance and reach across any distance.

  • I know that we can make this relationship work because no distance can take away how we feel about each other. You are and always will be the love of my life. I can’t wait for the day we will be reunited. I wrote you this sweet love letter to put a smile on your face.

  • They say, true love doesn’t mean being inseparable. It means being separated and nothing changes. That’s bullshit. Things are going to change while we’re separated. WE are going to change while we are separated. But that just means I’ll have the grand adventure of learning to love new things about you when we’re together again. And I can’t wait!
  • I’ll hold you in my heart until I hold you in my arms. There is no distance that can truly keep us apart. One day there will be no more “talk to you soon” or “see you in my dreams” when we end our conversation. There will only be real hugs and kisses because they are worth so much more than any words could express.

  • Missing someone gets easier every day because even though I am one day further from the last time I saw you; I am one day closer to the next time I will.

6 Best Movies Starring Christoph Waltz You Wouldn't Want To Miss Out

6 Best Movies Starring Christoph Waltz You Wouldn't Want To Miss Out

Christoph Waltz Best Movies

When it comes to captivating performances, Christoph Waltz knows how to steal the show. With his talent for bringing characters to life, he has left a lasting impression on audiences worldwide. If you're looking for some movie magic, here are six Christoph Waltz films you definitely wouldn't want to miss out on!

1. Inglourious Basterds (2009)

- IMDb: 8.4
- Rotten Tomatoes: 89%
- Available on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, Apple TV.

Inglourious Basterds 

In this Quentin Tarantino masterpiece, Waltz shines as Colonel Hans Landa, a cunning and ruthless Nazi officer. His portrayal earned him an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor, and it's not hard to see why. Waltz's performance is both chilling and mesmerizing, making "Inglourious Basterds" a must-watch for any film enthusiast.

2. Spectre (2015)

- IMDb: 6.8
- Rotten Tomatoes: 63%
- Available on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, Apple TV.

Spectre 

Joining the ranks of iconic Bond villains, Waltz takes on the role of Ernst Stavro Blofeld in "Spectre." As the mastermind behind the global criminal organization, Waltz brings a sinister charisma to the character. His on-screen presence adds depth to the classic spy thriller, making it a thrilling ride from start to finish.

- IMDb: 7.1
- Rotten Tomatoes: 70%
- Available on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, Apple TV.

3. Carnage (2011)

Carnage

In this dark comedy directed by Roman Polanski, Waltz stars alongside Kate Winslet, Jodie Foster, and John C. Reilly. The film follows two couples as they engage in a heated discussion after their children are involved in a playground altercation. Waltz's performance as a sharp-tongued lawyer adds a layer of tension to the already volatile situation, resulting in a compelling and thought-provoking watch.

- IMDb: 8.5
- Rotten Tomatoes: 87%
- Available on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, Apple TV.

4. Django Unchained (2012)

Django Unchained

Teaming up with Quentin Tarantino once again, Waltz delivers another unforgettable performance in "Django Unchained." Portraying the charming and enigmatic Dr. King Schultz, he brings a sense of moral complexity to the character. His dynamic chemistry with co-star Jamie Foxx elevates the film to new heights, making it a thrilling and poignant exploration of justice and revenge.

5. Big Eyes (2014)

- IMDb: 7.0
- Rotten Tomatoes: 72%
- Available on: Netflix, Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, Apple TV.

Big Eyes

Directed by Tim Burton, "Big Eyes" tells the true story of artist Margaret Keane and her struggle for recognition in the 1950s. Waltz takes on the role of Walter Keane, Margaret's husband, who takes credit for her distinctive paintings of wide-eyed children. His performance captures Walter's manipulative and charismatic nature, adding depth to this captivating tale of art and deception.
